Good morning,

 “And the Syrians had gone out on raids, and had brought back captive a young girl from the land of Israel. She waited on Naaman’s wife. 3 Then she said to her mistress, “If only my master were with the prophet who is in Samaria! For he would heal him of his leprosy.” 4 And Naaman went in and told his master, saying, “Thus and thus said the girl who is from the land of Israel.”

People, come in all shapes and sizes.  People seem to split apart from one another by ethnicity, social status, language, occupation, etc….  However I love to look at those that God chooses to carry out His will.  The Scriptures states that God is no respecter of persons.  Peter refused to reach out to the Gentiles at one point in his ministry.  God therefore gave him a vision in Acts while he was up on a roof a great sheet came down of four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and birds of the air.  God said to Peter, “Kill and eat,” but Peter replied, “No Lord.”  D. James Kennedy said, “You cannot say, ‘No, Lord,’ and mean both words; one annuls the other. If you say no to Him, then He is not your Lord.”  Peter eventually understood God’s lesson to him, and submitted to God’s will.  This is why the Scriptures states, “Then Peter opened his mouth and said:  “In truth I perceive that God shows no partiality.  Evans often shares, “God doesn’t call the qualified, He qualifies the called.”  God can use whosoever he chooses, to reach whosoever He calls to repentance.

In 2 Kings 5, God uses a slave girl to reach Naaman, Commander of the Syrian army and turn his heart toward the Lord.  This girl was taken from Israel and saw the leprosy of her master, Naaman.  She had compassion upon him and brought word to her mistress, “If only my master were with the prophet who is in Samaria!  For he would heal him of his leprosy.”  Naaman had a high profile job, he was extremely wealthy, popular, and was in the midst of war against the Arameans.  As far as social status, the slave girl was far below Naaman.  However God used her to reach Naaman.  Naaman brings this news to the King of Syria, and the King sent a letter with Naaman to the King of Israel, and Naaman brought, “ten talents of silver, six thousand shekels of gold, and ten changes of clothing,” which was in the vicinity of three-quarters of a billion dollars (The IVP Bible background commentary : Old Testament).  The girl told Naaman to go to the prophet, but Naaman first went to the King of Israel.  The King tore his clothes saying, “Am I God, to kill and make alive, that this man sends a man to me to heal him of his leprosy?”  Elisha hears what is going on, and tells the King to send Naaman in to him.  Naaman is told by Elisha to go and wash in the Jordan River and bob up and down seven times.  Naaman thought that this was the most ridiculous prescription for healing, considering the Jordan was forty miles away, to a river that was not known for being the cleanest of waters.  Initially, pride began to rise in Naaman’s heart as he disapproved of washing in the Jordan saying, “12 Are not the Abanah and the Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? Could I not wash in them and be clean?  Naaman eventually humbled himself and made the trip to the Jordan River, dipped seven times, and his leprosy was healed.
In the Scriptures, leprosy was a type of sin.  Just as the young slave girl saw the problem, so we must see the (leprosy) sin in the lives of people, no matter who they are, and lay the weight of God’s Law upon them that they too might humble themselves to be washed in the living water of Jesus Christ.  Thank God for the slave girl who gave Naaman directions which brought him to humble himself before God.  Will you be like the slave girl, and be an ordinary witness to the many you see daily who will die in their sin without the living water of Jesus Christ?

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phi <><

Good morning,

Psalm 1:1-4 (NLT)

 

Oh the joys of those who do not follow the advice of the wicked

Or stand around with sinners

Or join in with scoffers

But they delight in doing EVERYTHING the Lord wants

Day and night they think about His law

They are like trees planted along the riverbank

Bearing fruit each season WITHOUT FAIL

Their leaves never wither

And in ALL they do they prosper

 

Do you want joy? 

 

Of course, we all do.  And for Christians it is even more critical to have because the joy of the Lord is our strength.  (Neh 8:10)

 

So what are we to learn from this text about how to get joy?  God says there are some things you need to abstain from in order to have it.  That may not be popular but it’s the word of God and it’s worth it if the end result is true joy.  Verse 1 says “Oh the joys of those who do not” 

Stop for a second and remember that God just said to have joy we should not:    

 

1) Follow the advice of sinners

 

Keep in mind that some of us want to stay in sin.  We seek out people to get advice from knowing they are unsaved and will encourage us to do what we want to do regardless of how God sees that particular action.  Some of them are saved and still would rather tickle our ears than tell us the truth.  God have mercy on us! 

 

2 Tim 4:3

For the time will come when they will not take the true teaching; but, moved by their desires, they will get for themselves a great number of teachers for the pleasure of hearing them;

4:4

And shutting their ears to what is true, will be turned away to belief in foolish stories.

4:5

But be self-controlled in all things, do without comfort, go on preaching the good news, completing the work which has been given you to do.

 

Yes there is a time coming and lo is here when people will look for advisors and teachers and ministers who will tell them what they want to hear.  Let’s face it, anyone can do that.  But it takes love and courage to tell someone the truth when they don’t want to hear it

Sometimes the wrong thing sounds good but it won’t make u free.

 

John 8:32 And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

 

2) Don’t stand around with sinners

 

 Who are you hanging with?  We are in the world but not of it.

Sanctify yourself.  Consecrate yourself.  Be holy as He is holy.

 

God help us to obey You as we endeavor to be pleasing in Your sight.  Forgive us for the times we have been disobedient and help us even at this very moment to endeavor to change our ways and to allow Your grace and Your truth to set us free.  In Jesus name.  Amen. 
Melissa,

Good morning,

Math 16:5-20, “…thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church, and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it”

Let’s conclude the series by looking at the book of Acts 4. In the beginning we looked how Jesus had fed five thousand men with bread and how when He began to speak to His disciples He was talking about Himself as the bread of life. Through the process of revealing who He was and defining who the disciples were was to get them ready for greater works. Read it for yourself and you will see the Pharisees and the Sadducees attacking Peter and John the same way they attacked Jesus. All hell was breaking loose but Peter and John we not moved ’cause their identity did not come from any man but Christ. They knew who they were in Christ and that gave them the courage and boldness to respond to questions asked and be firm on what they believed.

In the early verses of Acts we see Peter feeding about 5 thousand men with the BREAD OF LIFE (God’s word), sounds familiar, Christ fed 5 thousand men with natural bread.  They are later asked by what means they were able to perform miracles with boldness, read Peter’s response in Acts 4:10, “Let it be known to you all, and all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, by Him this man (people)) stands here before you whole, vs. 11 This is the stone which was rejected by your builders, which is become the chief cornerstone”.  Amen!!! Christ is the stone that the builders rejected but praise to God He was and still the chief cornerstone and can no one change that fact. And being that He is the chief cornerstone of our lives, we are able to stand boldly like Peter and speak the truth, speak with confidence, face new situations and not be entangled by what we perceive or know about what we have been called. If you look at the life of Peter from the time he was defined to the time of him seeing these things happen, he faced many things and I believe people labeled him but that did not abort what Christ had defined him. Christ said, “Upon this Rock (Himself), He will build a church (Peter)… and now see it.

It’s not easy to adjust your life to something new when you are used to being called something else, Paul’s tells us, “This is one thing I do, forgetting what is behind and pressing on for those things which are before, I press towards the mark of the high calling (definition) (paraphrased) Phi 3:13&14. I was talking to a friend of mine who shared with me how when He was growing up, he was always told that he would never amount to anything and he has lived with that for many years and therefore he is afraid to make any moves for he believes he can never be good at anything. You may be feeling the same but He who has defined us has seen our future and with Him in control, let Him be the one to perfect it. You may not change people’s opinion about you but you can change to see yourself the way God does. He is the Potter and we are the clay. His hand is on the clay, making it the vessel He wants it to be. The devil’s is not the potter, thank God otherwise he would make us the instruments of unrighteousness. No one can define you like Him therefore choose to allow Him to be the one to do so.

Thanks
Evans

Good morning,

Math 16:5-20, “…thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church, and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it”

Psalm 127:1, “Unless the LORD builds the house, They labor in vain who build it; Unless the LORD guards the city, The watchman stays awake in vain.”. Our existence has everything to do with God. We’ve talked about Christ, the Bread of Life also we have touched on how is defining us that we may know who we are in Christ. Let’s see how Defines Peter, Vs 18, “And I also say to you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build My church, and the gates of Hades shall not prevail against it”. This is a very powerful line Jesus uses to define Peter. The first thing, He mentions his name “You are Peter”, I wondered why He  would start this way. Didn’t Peter know his name that he needed not to be reminded of it?  Let’s take look at why I believe He began this way. I believe this was to show Peter that Christ knew him from the beginning and He had already defined Peter and therefore there was nothing changing in him but being perfected to be who Jesus had already started in his life. He sounded like the same Peter but He was not the same Peter. It was him but it wasn’t him and by this I mean, he did not know what had been invested in him. Jesus was beginning to stir up a potential birthed by the Holy Spirit that would redefine who he was, not according to the world but according to God. “Unless the Lord builds the house…”

“And upon this rock I will build my church”, what rock is Jesus referring to?, we know that Peter in the bible is another name for the rock but see something powerful out of this. Turn with me to the book of Psalm 18:46, “The Lord lives and blessed be my Rock, let the God of my salvation be exalted”. Jesus Christ is the Rock that Lives and I believe that what He was telling him was that upon me (Jesus) in you (Peter), I will build my church (build a minister, build an evangelist in other words make him a vessel to be used to reach many) for we opened with Psalm 127:1 that talks about the Lord building the house. He is the already laid foundation that our lives may be built upon  1Cor 3:11, “For other foundation can no man lay other than that which is laid, which is Jesus Christ”. What a joy to know that I am not laying any foundations for Christ laid it on the cross when He died for my sins and that I am not building my life for His word says that unless He does it, it cannot be done.

“And the gates of hell shall not prevail against it”, I thought that if He is building my life upon the foundation He has laid then I’m set?, not quite for we still have to face many things everyday. The bible does not tell us that we will not have the gates of hell against us,  the bible says they will not prevail against us for what God has built, can nothing move. Isaiah 54:17, “Now weapon fashioned against us shall prosper…”, indeed they will be formed but they will not prosper because God has defined us to be a people who can stand in every circumstance and every situation for our lives are built on him the Rock that cannot be moved. You’ve got to be somebody in the kingdom for the gates of hell to fight you. The enemy will try and stop you from knowing who you are in God’s kingdom but thanks be to God, in the midst of our confusion, challenges, and weakness, none of this changes the content of the package. Do not let labels define the content of the package. One final piece for tomorrow.

Thanks
Evans

Good morning,

Matt 16:5-20, “…thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church, and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it”

Vs 13, “…Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am? Like Jesus, I get a little be curious to know how people define who I am. Jesus knew who He was (is) no doubt about that. He’s definition did not come from men but His Heavenly Father. Matt 3:17, “And suddenly a voice came from heaven, saying, “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased”. He knew men tried to define Him only to stand by what His Father had defined Him by. So He gets to a place where He wants to know from the disciples what men perceive of Him. vs. 14, “so they said, “some say John the Baptist, some Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets”. We labeled by men every day, not everyone thinks of you as someone God has created and has a destiny for. I am not surprised about how people even go as far as changing their minds about you based on your circumstances. If you do not know the content of the package (what’s in you), what you are labeled can affect you in so many ways.

Do you sometimes wound yourself by your own opinions about who you think you are? assassinating  how God has defined you because of what you perceive yourself to be. When you now talk to God, you talk to Him about who you see yourself while He talks to you about who He made you to be. Jesus was labeled as one of the prophets, John, Elijah and the rest. Remember that He knows who He is and what He has come to do but people’s opinion about Him does not change the content of the package. At least He knows what people think about Him, now the question comes to the people whom He has walked with, taught and fellowshipped with and He asks them the same question, vs. 15, “He said to them, “but who do you say that I am?” I believe that a good friend who really knows you well will know who you really are and not label you they way they want to or the way the world looks at you. vs. 16, “Simon Peter answered and said, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God”. Amen!!!!. Can you imagine someone adding to what you already know about yourself? it’s a sign of completion. I believe Jesus wanted them to understand who He really was so that they will not doubt Him when He sends them out. This must have been a turning point for the disciples for it was revealed to them by God.

You will agree of those times someone spoke something to you that confirmed what you already received. I know the world is not going to change it’s opinion about me and you, I am discovering more about who I am in Christ and no one can take that a way from me. Any one who tries to say something contrary to what God has defined me to be is a liar and should not be part of my life cause he or she will not build me up, but those who are seeing me through the eyes of God, will encourage me, strengthen me and help me achieve that goal of being who God has called me to be. The bible says choose your friends wisely for they know how to help bring the best out of you for they see you the way God’s does. Jesus had true friends the disciples, yes he does minister to everyone but when it comes to intimate stuff, He turns to His immediate friends.

Vs 17, “Jesus answered and said to him, “Blessed are you Simon Bar-Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven”. Blessed are those who calls you what God has called you, I’m blessed to know that my identity is not reduced to what I’ve got to face today or everyday, it’s not even based on my struggles in life, it’s based on what He has called me and if you don’t agree with what He has called me, I would rather choose to believe what He says about me over what you say about me. This ought to be our attitude when dealing with people, Psalms 139:14,”I will praise thee oh Lord, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made, great are thy works oh Lord and my soul knows it well”. Anyone who does not agree with me or you on that is a liar and we choose to believe what God says about me and you over what the rest might think. Choose ye this day who will define you!!! Boy friend or girl friend might try, husband or wife may also try but God who holds you in the palm of His hands knows you in and out, He knows you from the beginning to the end, He says that the very hair on our head are numbered, not counted Math 10:30. He is the one who will not change His opinion about what He has said about you. Whatever He says about you is final!!!

To finish

Thanks
Evans

Good morning,

Math 16:5-20, “…thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church, and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it”

A powerful word is coming to us this morning. It’s a word that will transform and revolutionize certain minds for it is a life changing word. It’s a word with power. Please take some time to read this passage because in the end I will connect it with Acts 4. Please read the word to prove what I share with you, check it out for yourself and prove it. 2Tim 2:15, “Study to show thyself approved, a workmanship that needs not to be a shamed, rightly dividing the word of the truth”

Vs 5-7, Now when His disciples had come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread, then Jesus said to them, “Take heed and be aware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the Sadducees”. And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “It’s because we have not taken bread”. In one hand, Jesus had been walking with the disciples, teaching them, performing miracles in their presence on the other hand Jesus had His attackers, the Pharisees and the Sadducees who were constantly on His case. On this particular time, the Pharisees and the Sadducees came asking Him to show them a sign from heaven before they could believe. Jesus full of wisdom did not yield to their questions for He responds to them in vs. 4 “A wicked and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and no sign shall be given except the sign of the prophet Jonah”. I kind of stopped and pondered for a second the sign that the prophet Jonah gave and it came to mind how he preached the wrath of God as a sign he was sent by God and the people knew for sure he wasn’t speaking of his own words but the words of God. The sign was given for the human kind to have an opportunity to decide who to follow. Today we still have so many people looking for signs before they can believe but the creation alone is a sign and declares the Majesty of the Lord. The fact that we can live is a sign that He loves and cares for us. Waiting for a sign to know whether He loves and cares for you? the gift of life, to stand and walk, to think and reason are signs He is in control.

Vs. 8-10 talks about the miracles Jesus did while He was with them. He reminds them of the time he fed 5 thousand men with 5 loaves of bread and again He shares with them about how he fed 4 thousand men with 7 loaves of bread. He is talking to them of the natural that ultimately He may bring them to the spiritual. He says. Vs 11, “How is it you do not understand that I did not speak to you concerning the bread”. They believed He is talking to them about the natural bread and how they forgot to carry bread to eat. Jesus explains to them how he supplied bread in the natural but being that they did not carry bread, they needed to remember that the BREAD OF LIFE was already with them. That the BREAD OF LIFE was more than enough to feed all men. He is getting them ready for a greater task and therefore He is beginning to impart in them some truth about what they need to know about Him and about themselves in Him. He is bringing them to the level where they can distinguish between the bread of men and the BREAD OF LIFE.

He is the BREAD OF LIFE, He is more than enough and I can share Him with anyone who desires to partake of this bread. He is always fresh bread and sweet. I don’t need money to eat this bread, all I got to do is be willing and obedient.

Thanks,
Evans

Good morning,

Luke 24:1-12, “…why do you seek the living among the dead?

Luke 24:1 begins by saying, “Now on the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they, and certain women with them came to the tomb bringing the spices which they had prepared”. Crucifixion and death of our Lord was predicted, Jesus Himself talked about it. He talked about how one of His disciples betraying Him, tried, crucified, die and be buried but He does not leave it there, He talks also about His resurrection. For if He died and did not rise then the whole point of dying would have been in vain. Let me make a point here, “there can be no resurrection without death”. For one to resurrect there has to be death; for one to rise up, there must be a fall; and for one to be saved, they must be living in sin.

They paid someone to have Him killed and then some people to keep Him dead. People not knowing what He is doing, He had borrowed an empty tomb for His use just for a weekend for He knew that His time in there is going to be very short after all He keeps on telling His disciples that He will die and on the third day resurrect. Didn’t we hear Him say that He will destroy the temple and build it in three days? People who should have kept the word had lost hope, had mourned and all the consolation they had  was knowing Jesus body was is in the tomb, the reason they would bring spices to anoint His body.

It’s first day of the week, they came to do they had been doing since they laid Jesus in the tomb, these faithful women Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James and other women with them who not only cared about the Master when He lived but also cared for Him when He was dead, they were dedicated to doing what they believe was right and they did it early in the morning. The bible says in  Isaiah 55:6, “Seek ye the Lord while He may be found, call upon His name while He is near” another verse in Deut 4:29, “But if from thence thou shall seek the Lord thy God, thou shall find Him, if thou shall seek with all thane heart”. Every day they sought and found the body as that is what they were looking for but on this particular morning, the normal wasn’t normal anymore for number one, they found the tomb stone rolled away; number two, the body was missing; three, the guards who were paid to guard the body were no where to be seen and four two men stood before them in shining garments.

Luke 24:5″…why do you seek the living among the dead?. The two men shinning in other gospels they are recorded as angels began to talk to them saying, “why are you looking for the living among the dead?”. It was good to come to the tomb and anoint the body but we needed to understand that He wasn’t going to be in there forever. Yes the body was there but the Spirit was a live.

We too have the tendency of going back to the grave yard to look and care for the dead and I’m not talking about physical death but spiritual death, we hang around the tombs, we spend our time there caring for the dead but we need to wake up to know that we are living and we got to be looking for the living for we are alive ourselves. If I’m going to the grave yard, I’m going there to have someone resurrected and not hang out there for the one whom I serve is not in the tomb anymore. There are so many who are still behaving as though Jesus is in the tomb still dead but I got news for you, He is risen, He is not dead anymore for I have been asked the same question, “why am I looking for the living among the dead Vs 6, “He is not here, but risen! Remember how He spoke to you when He was still in Galilee Vs 7 saying, “The son of man must be delivered unto the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again”. The empty tomb is a sign that He is no longer there and does not need it, another thing after He resurrected, He did not stick around the grave yard for He did not belong there. If Christ lives in you, you have been resurrected and therefore your dwelling place is not with the dead but with the living. Romans 14:9, “For to this end Christ died, and rose and revived, that He might be the Lord of both the dead and the living”. He is the only one who can be the Lord of both. He hanged out there for a short time because our sins led Him there but He rose, He defeated death, moved out. This is a sign for us, when we come back to life, we are out. Why are you still hanging around the grave looking for someone who is no longer there, unless you are there for another reason? why are you hanging around those people and hanging around those places where you know for sure is a grave yard (spiritually dead?) Sin causes spiritual death but when you have been saved, you are resurrected from the spiritual death and no more can you hang around the tombs for you do not belong there. You might have belonged there at one time but when you came back to life, God will not seek you among the dead but among the living. He did not deserve to be in the tomb but for the sake of men He did Romans 5:8, “But God demonstrates His love towards us in that while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us”. Was in the tomb, not anymore;

Happy Easter

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

We apologize for the delay, be blessed.

When one thinks about the concept of good, things such as a good meal, a good day, a good deal may come to mind.  However, when the concept of good is used in Scripture it correlates to, perfect and holy.

Christians around the world remember the culminating days of Christ’s passion with today being named, as Good Friday.  What is so good about this day?  Jesus is tried before the Sanhedrin, sentenced by Pilate, crucified and buried all before the Sabbath.  What is so good about all of this?   Put yourself back during the days of the disciples.  We look through hindsight, but those that followed Jesus didn’t have that luxury at the time.  They looked with eyes of various emotions, perhaps some emotions such as:  doubt, loss, discouragement, distress, bewilderment, sorrow, emptiness, duress, abandonment, depression, and defeat.  They heard was Jesus said was going to happen, but they were two days away from seeing the fulfillment of His words.  There are some incredible things that happened here.

First Jesus stands in submission to Pilate.  Jesus surely had greater power and authority to Pilate.  However, because of Jesus’ commitment to His Father’s will, Christ submits Himself to the Father in the Garden of Gethsemane, and thus to Pilate.  Pilate thought the he was running the show, he thought he was in control.  Christ exemplified that we too need a Garden of Gethsemane experience whereby we pray, “…not my will be Your be done,” and follow through with the prayer by our actions.

Secondly, Christ was worshipped in vain.  The soldiers stripped Him of His clothing, scourged Him, placed a crown of thorns upon His head and hailed Him saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”  The worship of Jesus became a mockery compared to times past, when many various persons Christ encountered came to Christ in sincere worship.  The soldiers made not only a mockery of Christ through blasphemous worship, but also of all those that worshipped Christ.  These soldiers didn’t realize that the One they mocked, would be worshipped by the world one day, and the toll would be reversed as Jesus the Judge would one day judge their lives by His standard of righteousness.  One soldier would later upon Christ’s last breath, cry out, “Truly this was the Son of God!”  Do you worship Christ in spirit and truth or flesh and lies?

Thirdly, Christ one carries the cross of Christ.  Christ was too weak to carry His own cross, so another, Simon, carried it for Him.  There is nothing comfortable about a cross.  Jesus said earlier to His disciples, “Mt 16:24 …”If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.”  As Christians we are each given a cross to bear, and by carrying it, we become more like Christ.

Fourthly, Jesus while he was being crucified prayed for the salvation of His murderers.  Jesus prayed, “Father forgive them for they know not what they do.”  Non-Christians do not know what they are doing when they mock your faith in Christ.  Do you forgive them for their ignorance, and mockery?  Christ exemplified how to love your enemies and commanded us to do the same (Matt 5).  Do you show love to your enemies?  Is there someone you need to forgive?

Good Friday, there is so much that Christ can teach us even before Sunday (Resurrection Day!)  Don’t miss out on these and the many more lessons found in reading the Scripture centering around Christ’s Passion.  Why is it called Good Friday?  Read the story, and experience the reason!  Then go tell your neighbor Christ died for them.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

title.rendered: What’s the deal with Barabbas?, By David Jackson and Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Focus: Matt 27:1-26; Mark 15:1-15; Luke 23:1-25; John 18:39-19:16

Barabbas was a Jewish national/zealot. Hebrew custom establishes the idea that Jewish parents name their children based on certain characteristics. Barabbas means “son of the fathers”; that is, “Bar” means son and “abbas” means fathers. Growing up, I bet Barabbas thought he was something special. He was the hope of Jewish history (son of the fathers). His name suggests that the Jewish nation had a lot riding on his shoulders (son of the fathers). Barabbas was the product of the long line of Jewish wise men and sages (son of the fathers). He embodied and represented them. Little is known about his parents other than that they were political figures and did not raise him themselves. It is said that Barabbas was raised by the community- being groomed for a purpose. He was not raised with a lot of discipline.

Historically, Barabbas came on the scene during the interim between the old and new testaments. At that time, the Jewish people were subject to Roman power. Some said that Barabbas was a ‘robin hood’ character. He was hot-headed, quick tempered, and had little difficulty using violence to accomplish his goals. To him, the end justified the means and he didn’t mind doing whatever he wanted, whenever, or by whatever means necessary. This lifestyle got Barabbas on Rome’s top ten list of wanted men. He had led a revolt in which several Roman soldiers were killed. He had stolen from the roman and Jewish treasuries. He was known for ambushing people and taking their belongings to finance the initiatives of his motley crew. And, interestingly, we find him (the son of the fathers) in Roman custody when he is first mentioned in the gospels.

Romans kept their notorious criminals in a jail that was located in the garrison of soldiers. This jail would be equivalent of the maximum-security prisons of today. This jail was about a half mile from the governor’s palace and tribunal.

The story opens with the Roman governor judging the case of Jesus. And, the governor gives the people a choice of choosing Jesus, the Son of God, or, Barabbas, the son of the fathers. Jesus was divine, Barabbas was not. Jesus was Son to God the Father and heir to heaven, Barabbas was son of human people and heir to a collapsed history and dejected people. Jesus represented choosing the divine while Barabbas represented choosing the least admirable qualities in us all. Truly, there was no comparison and the obvious choice of the people should have been to choose Jesus. Instead, the Jewish people chose Barabbas; the lesser figure, the substitute, the crook, the man.

But, this is not where I want us to contemplate. Let’s contemplate the story as it unfolds from the viewpoint of Barabbas. He was locked up about a half mile from where Jesus was at. From where he was located, Barabbas could hear the words of the crowd as they shout their responses in unison.

Imagine living close enough to Yankee Stadium whereby you could hear the chants of the crowd.  While you don’t hear the umpires, yet you can easily hear the crowd shouting “let’s go Yankees” or “de-fense”. You can predict what are going on because you can hear the crowds’ woes, boo’s, chants, and their cheering.  Now leave Yankee stadium, if you will, on this Resurrection Sunday, and go with me to the jail cell of one, Barabbas.

So, here’s Barabbas- locked up in jail. Now, remember, he could hear the crowds shouting in unison – but he couldn’t hear the governor. He hears the crowds scream:

1. Not this man, but Barabbas
2. Crucify him, crucify him
3. We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God If thou let this man go, thou art not Caesar’s friend: whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar
4. Away with him, away with him, crucify him
5. His blood be on us, and on our children.
 
Can you imagine what was going on in the mind of Barabbas? He had been in custody for a long time. He had not seen the face of another common  person nor had he had a visitor in years, besides a Roman soldier.  By this time, he was accustom to seeing the routine faces of the roman guards. No doubt he thought that the people had betrayed him- after all, he did all of his bad deeds FOR them, right? How dare they turn on him like this? He just heard the death sentence be pronounced on him.  This may sound all too familiar, but the crowd that perhaps once supported him was not turning on Barabbas, the son of the fathers, but on Jesus, the Son of God.

Now, imagine the dread and the fear that seized his soul. Imagine what the other prisoners thought or said to their “champion” as they heard the sentence. No doubt a reverent, dreadful silence fell over the place. I imagine that there was a long wait. And then, they heard the footsteps and the keys clinging in the distance- getting closer and louder. They heard the guards returning for Barabbas. For all intents and purposes, they all, including Barabbas, thought Barabbas was going to be summarily executed. But, something happens when the doors are opened to his cell, and the instruments of death tell him that he was free to go. Imagine the fear- yet excitement he felt as the chains and the instruments of his captivity and imprisonment were removed. Then, imagine the solemnity that gripped him when he was told or came to realize that Jesus took his place!

Application:  This is the week of Christ’s passion. As we reflect on these events, let’s consider how many times we chose Barabbas over Jesus in our lives.  Let us not forget the significance of the story. In Barabbas’s mind- he was as good as dead. He heard the death sentence. But, Christ took his place. It is entirely possible that Barabbas went on to live a holy life after that. Perhaps, he realized the true meaning of the exchange and sacrifice that Christ made on HIS behalf- and it was enough to turn him around and truly live a life that was worth his dying for.

You may be Barabbas today locked up in the jail cell of your sins. Perhaps you will have diner today, with Barabbas, one that is chained to their own sins.  Will you be like the Roman guard that released Barabbas?  How you ask.  Simple, show a person, a family member,  a loved one a friend, a neighbor, your mother, your father, your children, that they have violated God’s Holy Law, His 10 Commandments, and therefore are on death row, deserving of God’s capital punishment, eternity in hell, because they are in bondage to their sins.

This sounds harsh.  Does it?  Does it not sound harsher, perhaps evil, to let one you say you say you love, die in their sin.  We love getting together with family, but that is not what Easter, Resurrection Day is all about.  It’s always been about Jesus, his death, his burial, and most importantly HIS RESURRECTION!

Tell your loved one, AFTER YOU HAVE HELPED THEM TO SEE THEIR SIN AND THEIR BONDAGE that Jesus died in their place to set them free. Wouldn’t it be wonderful if today, there were those that repented and put their trust in Jesus Christ.  What are you waiting for, you may or may not have tomorrow and the following days to live.  If you have not repented, and put your trust in Christ, today is the day.  If you have not been a true and faithful witness then when you sit with your family, talk in a side room, be faithful to your Lord.

When you hear give us Barabbas, think, give us, Michael, Andrea, Anthony, my dad, my mom, my children because you desire them to be released but the Son of God, Jesus Christ.

May God richly bless you as you obey,

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil, and David

Good morning,

But Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you ask. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?” 39They said to Him, “We are able.” So Jesus said to them, “You will indeed drink the cup that I drink, and with the baptism I am baptized with you will be baptized; 40but to sit on My right hand and on My left is not Mine to give, but it is for those for whom it is prepared.” (Mark 10: 38– 40)

Have you ever asked a question to someone, but because of your lack of maturity and understanding, you came to receive an answer which exhibited, you really did not think through the whole of the question itself?  Children are famous for this kind of questioning.  Picture a child asking his mother (who is not pregnant) “mom I want you to have a child now, so I have someone to play catch with.”  The child doesn’t really know what he or she is asking.  In Mark 10 we read that James and John make a request to Jesus to sit on his right and left hand in Jesus’ Kingdom.  John Macarthur shares, “Matthew reveals that their mother accompanied them and spoke first (Matt. 20:20, 21), after which James and John reiterated her request. If she was Jesus’ aunt, the 3 undoubtedly hoped to capitalize on the family ties.”  Jesus replies, “You know NOT what you ask:  Are you ABLE to drink THE CUP that I DRINK…? 

Why would Jesus reply that they did not know what they were asking?  What was the cup that Jesus said that he drinks?  Jesus would drink the cup of sin-bearing death.    The Expositor’s Bible commentary shares, “Jesus’ answer is sharp and penetrating. The two disciples did not really know what they were asking. The way to privileged position in the messianic kingdom is not by grabbing for power but by relinquishing it through suffering and death. Jesus explains this to them by using the analogies of the cup and baptism. The cup, symbolizing trouble and suffering, is found in the OT. “In the hand of the LORD is a cup full of foaming wine mixed with spices; he pours it out, and all the wicked of the earth drink it down to its very dregs” (Ps 75:8). “Rise up, O Jerusalem, you have drunk from the hand of the LORD the cup of his wrath, you who have drained to its dregs the goblet that makes men stagger” (Isa 51:17; cf. also Mark 14:36; Jer 49:12; Ezek 23:31-34).”
Not understanding Jesus, They said to him “We are able.”  Jesus responds, ““You will indeed drink the cup that I drink…”  If Jesus was the ultimate cup bearer then what cup would the disciples drink?  In a sense they can and will drink from his cup of suffering. James would become the first apostolic martyr (Acts 12:2); and John would suffer exile on the Isle of Patmos, A.D. 63 (Rev 1:9).  Jesus is the ultimate cup bearer of course.  However, He is calling those that are His to be willing to lay down their lives for Him.  Laying down ones’ life is a daily process.  If one cannot give Christ their time, talents, and treasures, how can one give one’s life for Him?  In closing the words of a song by Christafari, “He died for me, so I live for Him, he gave His life, for me, so I can give mine to Him, He became like me, so I can become like Him.”  How are you drinking the cup today?  You may desire the cup be taken away, even as Jesus prayed, …take this cup from me,” however w ill you pray like Jesus, “Not my will, but Thy will be done.”  Realize as you pray Thy will be done, you must also pray, my will be gone.”  Do His will and see, God will never let you down.  

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

Good morning,
1 Samuel 30, vs. 6, “… but David encouraged himself in the LORD his God” (KJV) Believers fight the spirit of discouragement many times. The man of God Elijah was suicidal because of discouragement. The Israelites became discouraged when they faced challenges in the wilderness. It’s the same thing even leaders face today, discouraged from failing and discouraged by other people. Discouragement is the absence of courage. It deprives courage, hope or confidence.

David too was discouraged at one time. He had killed Goliath, he was a commander of six hundred. They subdued many enemies. While they were away in battle one time, the Amalekites invaded Ziklag where they had camped with their families. The Amalekites took away their wives, children, possessions and burnt the whole place down. The bible says, vs. 4 Then David and the people who were with him lifted up their voices and wept, until they had no more power to weep”. I remember about 15 years ago, coming from school one day only to find that robbers had broken into our house in our absence and nearly cleaned us out leaving us with nothing but things of no great value. Imagine things my parents had worked hard for many years to gain were all gone in one day. Like David and his men, we sat down and wept until there was no power left in us. The people who could encourage each other were all weeping because they were all victims. What do you do when there is no one around to encourage you? Or when the people you are close are in no position to encourage you?

You would imagine David’s men standing together in this but in Vs 6  “… David was greatly distressed, for the people spoke of stoning him, because the soul of all the people was grieved, every man for his sons and his daughters”, this was like adding salt to injury. When no one can encourage you, and those who should be standing with you are out to distress you, either you can choose to be discouraged like the Israelites or pick up yourself like David and do something about it.

In the midst of pain upon pain, David encouraged himself in the Lord his God. He chose to draw strength from God who is never discouraged. Jesus was left alone in his hour of need when the disciples scattered. One had betrayed Him, the other had denied Him. In the midst of excruciating pain and suffering, He encouraged Himself in the Father and the Father gave Him grace to endure. It was just for a little while before it was all done. I can imagine David thinking about the goodness of God, how God helped him fight many enemies, how God was his refuge and strength, a very present help in time of need. The more I believe he drew from the word of God, the more he got encouraged. This was not his courage, this was God’s courage driving away discouragement. He was encouraged that he turned around to encourage those who were discouraged.

The last week was tough for me, was not feeling well, then my car broke down with a huge bill to fix it. This all happened while sharing on the devotion “it’s a set up”. In the midst of it all, I encouraged myself in the Lord to know God is in control. I have learnt that I am my best encourager for I know exactly how I feel and I know what dose of courage medicine to apply where. You can not draw courage from without, you can draw from within. David did it IN the Lord so can you. Look at what the Lord has done, get into His word, get encourage in Him for when no one else can, you can in Him. Don’t let the devil see you sweat or tell you no one cares. Trade in your discouragement for encouragement.

Thanks

In the midst of the fire, Shadrach, Meshach and Abed-Nego were joined by the Son of God manifesting Himself in the situation to show them and the those present that they were not alone. One way the enemy will try to deceive you as God’s child is whispering in your ear that you are alone in a situation and even accuse you of failing.  Don’t listen to the deceiver, the bible calls him the father of all lies.

I love to walk and be with friends heading somewhere in life and Christ, they inspire me to stand for Jesus. They may inspire me by their words spoken or by their actions. I grow more when I look at some of my friends who aspire to walk with Christ even more and I desire the same. These three men must have been inspiring one another, encouraging themselves to stand through it all. Many do not sow like an eagle in the sky because they are sowing with turkey and we know turkey cant fly. I am careful about who I sow with and so should you.

Vs 26, 26 Then Nebuchadnezzar went near the mouth of the burning fiery furnace and spoke, saying, “Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-Nego, servants of the Most High God, come out, and come here.”. Men who were once ordinary men standing for the Lord were now being referred to as servants of the Most High God, what a relationship!!! They come out of the fire and being inspected, they discovered that they had lost no hair, their clothes and they were not even smelling smoke. This tells me that when God delivers you, you will not look or smell like where you came from. Everyone will wonder whether you have been in the fire

God wants to raise a people who can go through the fire and not loose their testimony, joy, peace and even confidence for He knows how to control the thermostat the enemy thought had control over. The law of the land is changed because of three men who came to a land they did not know about, face things they did not anticipate. They thought they came to work while God brought them to demonstrate His power through them. All along it was a SET UP for the Babylonians to see the true Most High God through 4 obedient young men. One shall chase a thousand, two shall put ten thousand to flight, three shall chase a hundred thousand and four shall put a million to flight. It’s not about addition its about multiplication, we come together we double, triple our forces.  Certain laws around us opposing the work of God can change if we are willing to stand and pray.

Remember the other day I quoted Job 23:10, “… After He has tried me, I shall come forth as gold?” well they made it out as gold with a greater testimony, greater faith, reached many people through their experience and got promotions not because of their qualifications but because of their stand. It was a set up all a long.

Don’t give up if you are in the midst of the furnace of fire, you are being refined for the next move. By the way, He is not through with us yet, I wonder what kind of set up He has in store for His people? I thank God for the Set Ups.

In one sense he thinks he is destroying, on the other sense he does not know that “ALL things work TOGETHER for GOOD for those who love God and to those WHO ARE CALLED according to HIS PURPOSE”.  Not only did they throw them in the fire, they also threw their belongings present with them at that time. Can you see how when the enemy attacks, he is out to destroy you and everything reminding him of you?

I can’t blame people who the enemy is using to throw me in the fire like those three men. If anything they are doing me a favor by letting God demonstrate His power and for His words through me  after all, Isaiah 54:17, “No weapon fashioned against thee shall prosper and any tongue that shall rise against thee in judgment thou shall condemn”, Mathew 16:18, “And I say, thou at Peter and upon this rock I will build my church and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it.

Situations may NOT change, the ability to endure in such a condition is a unique blessing  that is why I can quote confidently 2Tim 1:12, “For the which cause I also suffer this things: nevertheless I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and I’m persuaded that He is able to keep that which I have committed unto Him on that day”

While in the fire, the first thing that happens, the ropes used to bind them got burnt by the fire. God will not allow you to go through something still bound by the enemy, He would rather not change the situation but loose you from fear, confusion and frustrations and let you be comfortable in the midst of the tough situation demonstrating His power. He knows that if He can loose you, you can survive (swim with the sharks). The greatest thing about Shadrach, Meshach and Abed-Nego being in the fire, the son of God manifested Himself in the fire. I’m blessed to know that if He did not rescue me, He was with me in the midst of the fire with me. He did not go away or left me fight by myself. Now that He has been living inside of me, through my situation He reveals Himself so that my adversaries, friends, family members and colleagues may see Him in away that they had never seen Him before. If He wasn’t with me in the fire, I would freak out and more so be dead but I’m glad that He is there when I need Him the most. When you are in the fire, you don’t even fight for people to see Him for in the midst for your positive attitude, people will wonder what makes you different and when they take a closer look, they see Jesus. Don’t be discouraged by what you have to deal with, you do not know how many lives you are affecting by remaining steadfast through it all. 1John 3:2, “…but we know that when He shall appear we shall be like Him, for we shall see Him as He is”

Four men walking back and forth in the fire, I would expect them to want to get out of the fire but it seams as if they were comfortable in the fire. The presence of God will make you comfortable in tough situations. Everyone will be cursing, swearing and doing things under pressure but you will be keeping it cool. Something that was meant to destroy you has no effect on you? You are suppose to be burning and people watch and you are walking in the fire? You should be fighting your way out of the fire and you are not? What is happening here, HE  SET UP!!!!!. To finish

After he had finished making it, he commanded everyone to bow and worship the image he had made, no one excluded. Anyone who defied his order to worship his god, was to be thrown into a burning fiery furnace set for them.

This is terrible for we have four men righteous, they’ve served the Lord all their lives now  being tested in a foreign land? Here is a comforting word in Job 23:10, “… He knows the way that I take, after He has tried me, I shall come forth as gold”, This is where your faith is tested to see whether you live by faith, sight or by feeling. The bible says in Hebrews 11:6, “For without faith it is impossible to please Him, for he that comes to God must first believe that He is and that He is a rewarder of them that diligently seek Him”. They have walked with God by faith now their faith is put to a test.

Well we see it in this case too as the rest who saw these three men refuse to bow reported them to the king. Rom 8:38&39, “For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor the things to come. Shall we take a look at three men in the book of Daniel chapter 3:1-30. These men are Shadrach, Meshach and Abed-Nego, three Jews serving in the land Babylon under the king Nebuchadnezzar. Daniel is the main character in this book but besides him we are told of his friends who came with him from the land of Israel. These young men were brought over for a task to serve the king. If you look in the 1st chapter vs. 4, it says “…young men in whom there was no blemish, but good looking, gifted in all wisdom, possessing of knowledge, and quick to understand, who had the ability to serve in the king’s palace”. All these four young men had the qualification needed for the job but they had something even greater, God in their lives. They were not brought because God was in their lives, they were brought because of their abilities only that the king did not know that those qualities were gifts from God. They were clothed with humility, hard workers, pure, and holy just to add to the list. If the king knew these were God’s men, he might have changed his mind for he was living in idolatry.

In as much as the King thought that He had picked these men, the truth of the matter is God picked these men for a task in the land of Babylon. Anywhere the Lord sends us though we might have the qualifications to get us there like these men, we need to understand that there is a greater purpose for our being there. We may be serving in the king’s palace, serving in a job, in a home, or community and have some sought of idea why we are there. As time goes by, you begin to learn God had something bigger than what you thought. You begin to see why He opened that door. May be God gave you this job not just to make money as the primary reason but to reach out to people through prayers, love, encouragement. The bible says in 2Corinthians 4:7, “But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellence of the power maybe of God and not of us”. This line blows my mind for I am understanding that wherever I am planted, it’s not about me but about God. Whatever He does in my life should not bring glory to myself but to Him. Begin to take the glory and the credits and you will see how He will lift those gifts out of you and place it on someone who will give Him glory. He is a jealous God and He will not share His glory with any one. Anything He does is to give us a chance to lift Him up, John 12:32, “And if I be lifted up from the earth, I will draw all men unto me”. When you are working, lift Him up, humble yourself to know He qualified you to be there, and as you lift Him up, He will draw some of the people you work with, encounter with for it’s all about Him. Mathew 5:16, says “Let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your heavenly Father”. Once again we see the good works we do make people glorify God and not us for it’s all about Jesus. Daniel,  Shadrach, Meshach and Abed-Nego were brought to the land of Babylon mainly to do good works and in return men of that land would glorify God as we will see.

This is just an introduction to what we are going to get to but I want us to see things differently as we venture into the journey God has called us as workers in our jobs, workers in the ministry and even in our homes. I believe God is setting some people up for something awesome and extraordinary, humble yourself to be a vessel He can use. 1Peter 5:6&7, “humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that He may exalt you in due season, casting all your cares upon Him for He cares for you”. If you haven’t noticed, it’s a set up.

Good morning,

1John 3:1, “Behold what manner of love the Father has bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God”

I have not finished the series on “Raised From Among Them” yet. I hope to finish it this week but let me talk about something that I usually find hard to talk about simply because it’s the type of thing you have to experience. In 1John 3:1 starts us with the love of the Father and he says Behold what manner of love the Father has bestowed upon us. I could stop there for this is just a good word, this no ordinary love this is an extraordinary love, it’s the type of love that we have not earned it has just been bestowed upon us.

Not too long ago Pastor Phil shared on “Does God have a need?”, in other words, was God craving for love that He had to make us to love Him? No, God did not need us to love Him, He chose to create us then commended His love towards us.  Think of the heart of man according Jeremiah 17:9, “The heart is deceitful above all things and desperately wicked, who can know it? …”.  How can you love such a being with wickedness? This tells me that He loved me with an everlasting love that despite who I am and what I have done to which He knows perfectly well, He still commanded His love towards me. God had no business loving us and to leave us thinking, He had no reason to send His son into the world. John 3:16 a common verse, “For God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten son”. Perfect love gives the best, God loved the sinners in the world that He gave. Perfect love finds us empty and fills us up, that is what the Lord did for up when He saved us for we were wretched and empty. Perfect love over looks our flaws and still loves us anyway.

The perfect love allowed us to be called the sons of God when we were worthy to be. Remember the prodigal son who went to a far country and wasted all the wealth that he had inherited, when He came home, all he desired was to be made a servant but the Father welcomed him with open arms, embraced him, kissed him, loved him and welcomed him home. What a perfect love!!!!! He deserved to be thrown out because of what he did, he came back knowing that he was not worthy to be a son any more and yet the Father bestowed love upon him and made him a son again. If watched the movie “John Q”, it’s a movie depicting perfect love as we see a child who is about to die because of heart failure and because the Father loves him so much, he is willing to do whatever it takes to have his son well. Everyone has given up to the fact that he can live but the Father refuses to believe anything outside his healing. He comes to appoint where is willing to sacrifice his heart that his son might live. The child does not know much about what this love is all about but the Father demonstrates by willing to die for him. Romans 5:8, “But God commanded His love towards us that we were yet sinners, Christ died for us”. Christ absolutely had no reason to go through a horrible death just for the sake of the people who will still fail anyway but because God commanded his love towards us, He was willing to die for the ungodly. He has loved me with an everlasting love and with that love, He has drawn us to Him. God is the lover of our soul first then our bodies. if He loves our souls, he loves our entire being in spite of who we are. I’m amazed by that. If you don’t feel loved by anyone, gather courage, stand right in front of the mirror and say, “He loves me”.

I want each of us to know this morning that God loves us individually and collectively, let not the devil whisper to you that because you failed in an area he has stopped loving you. His love is not based on what we did or do but what He did and is doing. His love fits like a glove,  accept it.

Thanks

Good morning,

Mathew 21:16, “…Out of the mouth of babes and nursing infants, You have perfected praise”

I have come to believe to know someone really well, see how they deal with pressure. I try to choose not to be stressed out for it is not healthy. I refuse curse or swear when things come my way because cursing and swearing don’t help anyway, it’s not a mark of a Christian and out of cursing mouth can no sweet praises come.

We need to understand that we are responsible for our actions and therefore we need to be very careful about how we deal with overwhelming situations and circumstances. One of the greatest tools to help overcome tough times is praise, praise is not a matter of how we feel but a choice we make to do it anyway. The bible tells us from the verse above that “out of the mouth of babes and nursing infants, You have perfected praise”, this to me shows that it’s not for some people of a certain class but for everyone. The moment you make the choice, the Lord will perfect it.  Psalms 150:6, “Let everything that has breath praise the Lord”.

Isaiah 61:3, “…To appoint unto them that mourn in Zion, to give unto them beauty for ashes, the oil of joy for the mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they maybe called trees of righteousness, the planting of the Lord, that he might be glorified”. There is a time to mourn, at time to be down, a time to get discouraged but you can never be in the same place forever, you got rise up for the Lord is changing you to fit in the atmosphere and giving you what you do not have to so as to praise Him. Number one, He is giving us beauty for ashes, other translations says a crown of beauty instead of ashes. He is making us worth something and then here comes the oil of joy for the mourning. No joy, no praise and there is a difference between being happy and being joyful. Being happy goes with the mood while being joyful goes with what is given and choosing to make it work regardless of what you have to face. The bible says that the joy of the Lord is my strength, His joy gives you strength to endure. Number three, He gives us the garments of praise for the spirit of heaviness. Well to me this is the main thing and as you can see that a garment of praise has been made but you and I have to grab it and put it on for many are wearing the garments of heaviness. Garments of heaviness in this case could be stress, frustrated, pressure, overwhelmed by what you have to deal with. You have a choice to remove the garments of heaviness and put on the garments of praise and say, “I have so much to do and the more I try to reduce my work load, the more they keep on coming, I know that I should be whining and complaining and I should be putting a face but I choose to take off the garments that pull me down and put on the garments of praise for you have entrusted me with these loads of work and you will not give me more than I can handle”. Thank you for giving me the grace to endure, I praise you for the best in me is coming out under all this pressure. This makes me to be calm in the midst of my storm. Many are seeing me deal with things differently and it’s not because I’ve got everything together but because you have given me a new garment” This ought to be our attitude for the same God who has allowed so much work to come our way is the same God who will give us enough grace and strength to make it but the only way we will make it is by adjusting our attitudes and taking what He has set aside to help us make it through the day and that is the garments of praise.

In 2chronicles 20: when King Jehoshaphat was faced by a great army, he proclaimed a fast throughout the land and all people including animals cried to God and in vs. 15, a word comes to them saying they didn’t need to fight in this battle for the battle was the Lord’s. Therefore they thought to themselves, if the Lord is going to fight for us, we can do something else, we can praise Him. The moment they began to praise the Lord, The Lord  was moved by their praised that He set an ambush upon the enemy. The king and his people did not see God fight but they saw the results. You praise Him and you will not see Him fight, you will only see results. Walls of Jericho came down under the power of praises and shouts. Put on the garments of praise this morning and let the praise go before you as you start the day.

Thanks
Evans

Good morning,

Ezekiel 37:1-14, “And He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?”

It’s easier for me to talk to someone about hope, peace and faith. It’s easier to encourage someone who is going through hard times and even see them coming out of it but when it comes to me facing the same things, I find it hard to encourage myself..

Talking about prophet Ezekiel, he preached a message of hope to the exiles in Babylon yet the people he spoke to did not see things the way he spoke them. I’m not sure whether him speaking made a difference in his life but still he spoke. Ezekiel 37 is a very familiar passage about the valley of the dry bones. A place anyone would want to avoid. No one wants to go to the valley or live in the valley, people would rather live in a plain land or more so live up the hill. Celebrities love to build houses up the hill, a place where everyone can see their property. God in this case brings Ezekiel to the valley and not just any valley but a valley full of dry bones. Valley often times is associated with death, Psalm 23:4, “Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death…”, a place of no hope, a dry place, a creepy place, in simple, a place with no life. I will submit that greater miracles happen in the valley. I tend to see more of God’s greatness through my times in the valley. Not that I want to be in the valley but I appreciate the times that I have been in the valley, it was a place of preparation for me. Did not like it, but it was vital. The Spirit of the Lord led Ezekiel in the valley, caused him to pass by all the bones, saw how they were so many and very dry. Look around you and see so many dry bones, dry marriages, dry community, dry churches, dry relationships, dry city, dry life. Very discouraging when you see all these and can do nothing about them.

Ezekiel 37:3, “And He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?…” what would you say if you were asked the same question. Can this marriage survive, relationship, life, the lost, backsliders you name it, can they be restored? It puzzles me when I face myself with these questions. We have prayer requests that come in, people who need healing, people who need their jobs restored and I ask myself the question, can it be done? how about you, can you see a desire that has been dead for many weeks, months, years being restored? The same question God asked Ezekiel is the same question we are being asked this morning, can these bones live????

Ezekiel 37:3, “…so I answered, “O Lord God, You know”. What a wise answer, if he said they could live and God did not do anything, Ezekiel would have been a liar and if he said they could not live and God made them live, he would have still been a liar. What I’m I saying, the outcome of a situation depends on what He does. I don’t know whether people will be healed, He knows and so is a marriage, job and all things that you have given up hope on. Could it be the answer God was looking for? probably. God knows what dilemma you and I are in and the answer of it lies in His hands. This is what I call “HE CAN”, whether He is going to do it or not is not an issue, the issue is “CAN HE?” Whether God is going to do it or not moves me less, my dilemma is can I trust His hands to know what to do? There are people who come to God to ask for something but don’t believe HE CAN do it, they are just giving it a try to see if He has the ability to make it happen.

If God is going to do it, He is going to have to use something to make it happen. Martha and Mary sent a message to Jesus to come and heal their brother who was sick, Jesus did not show up until Lazarus was four days dead . They understood that the outcome of the situation lied in the hands of Jesus, John 11:22, “But even now I know that whatever You ask of God, God will give You”. Jesus called Lazarus out of the tomb, God spoke through Ezekiel. Ezekiel 37:4, Again He said to me, “Prophesy to these bones, and say to them, O dry bones, hear the word of the Lord! vs. 5, Thus says the Lord God to these bones: “surely I will cause breath to enter into you, and you shall live”. What would you do if you were told to speak life into what you can’t see life in? This prophet who said God knows is asked to prophesy life into these bones. Mark this, IT’S THE WORD OF GOD AGAINST THE CURRENT SITUATION. “Faith comes by hearing and hearing by the word of God” and this is what He is basing his faith in, what God has spoken. It did not matter what had happened and how he could not see them come back to life, the instruction was simple, prophesy in My name.

You can try and make some sense out of your situation and not see it work out, leave it in the hands of God and when God gives you a word, speak life into it. Remember it is His word and not yours. If it backfires, shift the blame on Him but I heard Him say, “My word shall not return void…” “I am not a man that I should lie…” I see so many dry bones around me, the life of those dry bones are in His hands, all I can do is prophesy according to His word, do the same.
Thanks
Evans

Good morning,

1Samuel 17:1-58, “Then he took his staff in his hand; and chose for himself five smooth stones from the brook…”

1Samuel 17:32, “Then David said to Saul, “Let no man’s heart fail because of him; your servant will go and fight with the Philistine”. When no one had faith to face the giant, David did. Everyone including the king did not feel David is ready for he is young, inexperienced and had training background. I’m reminded of these words, “The battle is the Lord’s”, David was just an instrument at the right time to be used to finish what God had started. 

vs. 38, “So Saul clothed David with his armor…”, you can’t fight in someone else armor, BE YOURSELF. If they could not use it to get victory, how do they expect you to use it to get one? Use what you know works for you because you have tested and proven it. May be Saul  thought, since Goliath is equipped and ready, trying to dress David with armor could have helped. All David needed was his point of REFERENCE (what God had done in his life before) and TRUST of what God was going to do if remained himself. When you get a chance for a new position, make a difference, witness etc, I would encourage you to be yourself. David could not fight with what he had not proven and so are we.

1Samuel 17:40, “Then he took his staff in his hand; and chose for himself five smooth stones from the brook…”. This is the core message. David took his staff not anybody’s and went to the brook and picked out five smooth stones. This to me has a great significance for stones represent good skills to win a battle. We are shown where he picked them from, the brook. The bible says, “you shall be like a tree planted by the waters, Elijah was brought to the brook, The bible says, “Jesus is the living water”, “out of your belly shall flow rivers of life”. This shows that David was picking what he needed from God. Mark this, the stones were smooth and polished not just any stone. Have you and I picked the smooth stones from the brook of God to overcome?. Talents, abilities, strengths to mention a few?. On your job resume, you talk about your abilities and strengths, right?. The employers tend to look at some of this because they become an advantage to what they are looking for. If you have smooth stones of meeting deadlines, honesty, dependable, adaptable and the like, this would add to your qualifications. You have to pick out your smooth stones to get you anywhere. What are your smooth stones? David picked his from the brook. Where do you get yours from?

Just to go back a little bit to what I have shared, it is true we have Goliath’s around us who blasphemes the name of the Lord everyday and we say nothing. People who use the name of Jesus as curse word, instead of using a four letter filth word to express disgust they take the holy name and use to instead. Suppose you are married and someone used your wife’s or husband’s name as a curse word, how would you feel? would you sit there and take it in? We do that many times, people take the Lord’s name in vain and we say nothing. Goliath was defying the name of the Lord and no Israelite said nothing until one young man came to the field and could not stand it.

1Samuel 17:45, “…You come to me with a sword, with a spear, and with a javelin. But I come to you in the name of the Lord of hosts, …”, many believe that the stone brought the giant down but I believe what David spoke to the giant melted his heart and showed God so strong. All Goliath now saw was not David but God in David and the stone was an outward evidence to the rest of what God could do. Your smooth stone will only finish the job God has started in you. Your confession is, “I am able with God’s help”. We pray give us a chance as long as we know we can truly depend on God to see us through. David might have not had what was required for the battle in the natural sense but in the spiritual sense he did. My prayer is, “Lord, give us a chance and we will show You so strong before men”. Blessings Evans

Good morning,

1Samuel 17:1-58, “Then he took his staff in his hand; and chose for himself five smooth stones from the brook…”

The bible is interesting in the sense that it could take time and dwell on something, talking about it and describing it. Let’s go back to 1Samuel 17:4, “And a champion went out from the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath from Gath, whose height was six cubits and spans” Read it until vs. 7, 4 verses talks about nothing but how the giant was dressed for battle. The bible wants us to see something about this man. Just reading how equipped he was, I could see why the Israelites were afraid of him. This is no ordinary sizable man. I wondered why the bible wouldn’t just say he was a giant and a champion. I believe the Lord wants us to know that our enemy is not a wimp as many may think. He is prepared for you and I at any given moment. Goliath was more qualified, trained, prepared, ready, equipped, eloquent, developed, sophisticated, protected, confident, threatening and a fighter, what chance did David have? All the trained men, who have all that it takes to battle could not face the giant. Wondered why the bible does not even take time to describe how Saul was dressed for the battle?. The Lord would have us know that no matter how big, strong and well prepared the enemy might be, our stand is in 1John 4:4, “ye are of God, little children for you have overcome them: because for greater is He that is in you, that he that is in the world”. You might stand at a place looking at the position God allowed you to encounter with and you see how it is prepared with it’s requirements and boy you get scared silly as whether you can handle it. If you know who you are in Christ and Christ brings you to see what you did not even ask for, that is a sign that He will qualify you to overcome it. I have seen this work in my life, God brought me to something that I wasn’t even qualified for as the description showed me how that Goliath was dressed but “God is not a respecter of persons, He is a respecter of principles”. If God brought you to this point, believe that He will take you to that point, Philippians 1:6, “Being confident of this very thing, that He which has began a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ”

This is the concept David learnt when the rest could not and with that in mind he set himself to fight the giant and the first obstacle was his brothers. 1Samuel 17:28, “Now Eliab his older brother heard when he spoke to the men; and Eliab’s anger was aroused against David..” Sounds familiar?, not everyone is ready for your progress, some say, “there is no way you can make it”, “there is no way you can have that position”, “there is no way you can change that department”, “you have nothing it takes to make a change, look at us who are more qualified and should do it but we are not because we are unable”. To make the matter’s even worse, the brother accused him of coming to watch the war, accused him of pride, and was reminded of where he belonged in the wilderness with the sheep. What would you do if you have believed in yourself and God to make it then you have someone in the church, in the home, a friend discourage you? they speak death into you saying, “there is no way you can make it?”. David would have said, “well you are right, I will pack up my stuff and go home”. This was not his attitude, if he went back home, that would mean he couldn’t trust God enough, already he knows that he did not come to the battle ground to watch yet he has been accused of it, he begins to see that God set him up cause he wasn’t looking for this job. He just knows that he has a chance to show God so strong among His people.

Ask yourself this question, maybe you were not looking to be somewhere but God’s graciously brought you to that place, you know of your limitations, you have things and people trying to discourage you from doing what is right, something that will bring honor to His name. You have a chance to make a difference, you know who is in you, what will you do about it?. Is your desire to have a chance? To continue,
