content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Corinthians 3:1-23,  “vs11 For no one can lay any foundation other
than the one already laid, which is Jesus Christ” NIV

We defined foundation and looked at how possible at times it is to look to man as foundation rather than look at man God uses to lay a foundation. At Corinth, Paul had laid a good foundation “Jesus Christ and Him crucified” but instead of them building on THIS foundation, they started trying to redefine the foundation which moved them from the spiritual growth to become carnal minded. Thank God that Paul came back to correct their understanding and thank God He is correcting the understanding of those who missed it.

Paul laid a foundation, but he was not the foundation. Paul and Apollos were nothing, God was ALL. Without God, their labor was in vain. He says, ” “vs11 For no one can lay any foundation other than the one already laid, which is Jesus Christ”. God has already laid His foundation on His word the bible, no one can go around and lay another foundation. Many Religions have tried over and over again to lay another foundation instead of building on THIS foundation laid. I refuse to be called a religious person simply because being born of God is not about religion but RELATIONSHIP. Many religion teach that you have to find your way to God by doing the so called good works while Christianity based on the word of God teaches that it’s only by grace we are saved. Grace lays the foundation that we could never lay and there can be no other foundation again thereafter. Jesus said in John 14:6, “I am THE way and THE truth and THE life. No one comes to the Father except through me”. “THE” tells us that it’s only by Him the sure foundation comes about.

10″By the grace God has given me, I laid a foundation as an expert (master) builder, and someone else is building on it. But each one should be careful how he builds” The main work of a master builder is contribute knowledge rather than labor, if Paul had laid a foundation “Jesus Christ and Him crucified”, then now he is giving knowledge that they will need to build themselves while others also help them. He also warns them to be careful of how they build. How we each build matters, Paul writes, 12If any man builds on THIS foundation using gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay or straw, 13his work will be shown for what it is, because the Day will bring it to light. It will be revealed with fire, and the fire will test the quality of each man’s work. 14If what he has built survives, he will receive his reward. 15If it is burned up, he will suffer loss; he himself will be saved, but only as one escaping through the flames. These verses challenge me because I understand that to build on THIS foundation, it’s not about happiness as many teach, it’s about something bigger than that, Romans 14:17 tells  ” for the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit. 18 For he who serves Christ in these things is acceptable to God and approved by men”. You can see that happiness is not a material towards building an everlasting building, righteousness, peace and joy in the Holy Spirit are THE KEY materials. Happiness comes and goes. The rest of good things are benefits for serving. So let’s build on THIS foundation with the KEYS that will survive the fire rather than benefits that will not. The KEY materials are the pillars that hold the building. So who is our sure foundation “Jesus Christ and Him Crucified”, therefore let’s be careful that we do not blindly exalt one that lay foundation and let’s be careful that the master builder gives us the right knowledge that we will use to build on THIS foundation. Let’s careful about how we build.

title.rendered: The Sure Foundation Is Christ, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Corinthians 3:1-23,  “vs11 For no one can lay any foundation other
than the one already laid, which is Jesus Christ” NIV

Foundation is the defining moment for anything expected to succeed. The process and outcome of it is traced back to the foundation and  how the foundation is laid will determine the basis on which a thing stands. Foundation is the defining moment of what we are made off. Parents try to lay a foundation for their children, husbands and wives try to establish a foundation for their marriage and so is a church, a corporation, schools etc. If the foundation is wrong, anything built on it may be crooked, not survive for long and is very dangerous. This is the whole reason it takes time to lay foundation. And from looking at how foundations are laid especially in buildings, it has to go down first before it comes up.

Paul addressed Christians at Corinth not as spirited men, those who he believe to have matured. He found that the people who should have been growing were not because they were trying to define again the foundation already laid. Instead of building on what was already laid, they were still dealing with petty issues such as jealousies, quarrelling and divisions fighting over who to follow Paul or Apollos. I see this problem even today where people are disputing on whose teaching to go by, who to follow, causing the same problems Paul found at Corinth. If you don’t know and understand the foundation then like the Corinthians, you will try to establish a foundation laid by man. The problem is, man fails, what happens when your favorite preacher stumbles and falls, would you fall too If your foundation is laid on him, where will your destiny be?. What about you mentor, your spiritual leader.

 5, What, after all, is Apollos? And what is Paul? Only servants, through whom you came to believe-as the Lord has assigned to each
his task (NIV). It’s interesting to note the “WHAT” used in this verse rather than “WHO”. “WHAT” addressed their laboring service as opposed
to “WHO” that addressed their personalities. Those who followed Paul might have chosen him because of his personality and style of doing
things and so were those who followed Apollos. He reminds them that him and Apollos were channels through which they believed. Their
teaching was not for people to believe in them but the message they brought to them as assigned by God. Here is how he ties himself to
Apollos,  vs. 6, I planted the seed, Apollos watered it, but God made it grow. 7,So neither he who plants nor he who waters is anything, but
only God, who makes things grow”. Paul and Apollos were both laborers, the controlling factor in what they were doing was LABORING and not
SUCCESS. Now I understand why Apollos ministry was not a threat to Paul’s he understood they were co laborers. Yes they were different in
their ministries but they were building on a foundation already laid. Today we see competition and insecurities among preachers, pastors,
leaders on who can be the most successful maybe business wise, size of congregation, size of budget, facilities and we can easily get sucked
in all these that we follow men’s teaching principals rather than God’s. The key factor in this chapter is God who MADE IT GROW. The
planting by Paul and the watering by Apollos was nothing if God did not make it grow. This establishes this fact, “The creation and
fostering of faith is God’s work alone”. If a spiritual leader’s message and style is your foundation then you are trading on a very dangerous foundation. Christ is the solid rock on which we stand, all other grounds are sinking grounds. They can lay a foundation but they
are no foundation. To continue

Good morning,

“Now the LORD had said to Abram: “Get out of your country, From your family And from your father’s house, To a land that I will show you. cI will make you a great nation; I will bless you And make your name great; And you shall be a blessing. I will bless those who bless you, And I will curse him who curses you; And in you all the families of the earth shall be blessed” (Gen 12:1-3).

In Divine Movement part one; we looked at how God moved Mary and Joseph from Nazareth to Bethlehem that the Scripture might be fulfilled.  In part two we examined how God moved Noah and his family into the ark before God flooded the whole earth.  Now let us turn our sights toward Abraham and how he became the blessed Father of Many Nations.  God said that He would make the name of Abraham great, and that in him all the nations would be blessed.  There are three major world religions that hold Abraham in high esteem:  Christians, Jews, and Muslims.  Let us look at what Abraham had to do to comply with God in becoming the Father of Many Nations.

GET OUT OF YOUR COUNTRY.  Have you ever visited another country before?  I love to travel to other countries.  I find it to be an exciting joy to journey to another land and to learn about the history, culture, and people of the country that I am visiting.  Can you imagine for a moment if God interrupted your life and commanded you to get out of your country and that he would bring you to the destination that He had in mind for you?  How many of us would jump for joy at this initial moment?  When God moved Abraham He moved him from the familiar to the unfamiliar.  When I traveled to other countries I planned the trip, however, when Abraham was in Ur of the Chaldeans he did not initiate the move from Ur to go to the land of Canaan. 

LEAVE YOUR FAMILY, YOUR FATHER’S HOUSE.  How attached are you to your family?  Some are so attached to their families that the thought of moving away from them is non-negotiable.  However, this is precisely what God commanded Abraham to do, leave his family.  Now of course Abraham didn’t leave his wife, and he also took some of his herdsmen with him as well as his nephew Lot, but he left his father’s house and all those aunts, uncles, cousins, etc… that he and his wife were familiar with.  When God created Adam (Gen.2) and his helpmate Eve, he told Adam, “Therefore a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and they shall become one flesh.”  When I moved to NYC to follow the Lord’s call of ministry I had to leave my family, even though they are only an hour away from me, it still was a significant change for me.  When God moves you, there are many times when He will command you to leave your family, the place that you are comfortable with, and the people that you are comfortable with.  What does this do in you?  This causes you to trust the God who goes before you.  God is omnipresent (ever present), he is where He is taking you.  God knows the people and places that he commands you to go.  The only question remains, will you actually GO and trust the rest to Him.  Can you trust God to take care of the details? 

GO TO A LAND THAT I WILL SHOW YOU.  God had not told Abraham what his destination would be.  This would not be very reassuring for many of us.  I like to know at least where I am going.  If God told you Go, and when you arrive I will tell you to stop, how many of us would pack
up and move?  Do you trust God’s leading?  Do you walk by faith, or by sight?  When God calls you to move, be willing to leave the familiar places, people, and leave the steering of the course to Him? Perhaps this is where the famous adage was founded which reminds us,
GO WITH GOD.”

Until the nets are filled…

Blessings,
Pastor Phil <><

Good morning,

Romans 12:1&2, “…do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect will of God”.

On where we left, we talked about that the sieve separates what is acceptable and rejected. Paul writing to the Romans he starts in chapter 12 by saying “I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, ACCEPTABLE to God, …”. Could it be that the Romans thought their lives in were in line with God? Like the floor that was not sifted, everything looked ok on the outside until the sieve revealed, the same we see Paul doing here. He tells them to present their bodies a living sacrifice, holy and acceptable to God, the next thing is “do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and ACCEPTABLE and perfect will of God”. I keep emphasizing the word ACCEPTABLE because I see over and over in my life God exercising His will based on what is ACCEPTABLE. Paul takes the next three and half chapters teaching the Romans what is acceptable Romans 12, 13, 14, 15:1-8. This would mean, all these would pass through the sieve because they are acceptable to God.

People tend to have their own definition of what is acceptable, the Word of God should be our source of knowing. Here is where whatever we are now asking, we are asking within the boundaries of what is acceptable. In re reading Romans 12:2, towards the end of the verse it says, “..that you may prove what is that good and acceptable…”, we have done that based on His word, here comes what I think is hard to grasp “… and PERFECT WILL of God”. Not sure who else has gone through this where you thought you were in God’s perfect will on a given thing only to discover later you were not. It appeared spiritual yet it was carnal, you may have thought you heard from the Lord. It troubles me sometimes then I get comfort knowing that God is working in me based on what is acceptable while directing my paths and yours. He is working in you, Philippians 2:13, “for it is God who works in you both to will and to do for His good pleasure”, He is directing you Proverbs 3:6, “In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He shall direct your paths”, He is ordering your steps, “Psalm 37:23, “The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD, And He delights in his way.

The more we walk with the Lord, the more we learn, the more we grow, the more we are transformed, the more we operate in His will. At times it may not be clear right away what His will is for our lives but as we go through the sieve, we are sifted to know what is acceptable and we pray for God’s will and direction within the boundaries of His word. We are no longer just praying for anything because it’s our desire, we pray thy will be done. As we pray and get in the word, the more we are changed, the more the sieve reveals stumbling blocks, impurities and our character. I believe that we can know God’s perfect will for our lives because we know what it takes. David says, Psalm 139, “23 Search me, O God, and know my heart; Try me, and know my anxieties; 24 And see if there is any wicked way in me, And lead me in the way everlasting”. To be in God’s will, he had wanted to be tried in the sieve so are we.

Romans 12:1&2, “…do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect will of God”

I struggle sometimes to know what the will of God is for my life. I have no problem knowing the will of God for His children but when it boils down to one narrowed down to my life then it becomes a struggle. Often times you hear the messages “claim it and receive it” then you go to the scriptures and find there is more to it than claim it and receive it. I see more preparation because God would not want to give us something that is good but destroys our lives. I have seen people who were blessed of God, you could tell 100% that it was God who made it possible but then you see how that blessings becomes a stumbling block in their lives. I ask myself why? then I’m reminded that God is in the business of forming before He can fill. Many want to be filled and insist on being filled without being formed.

The word of God sets us up to know God’s will yet for us to know God’s will it starts Mathew 6:33,  which says to us to seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and ALL these things will be given to you as well”. Does that mean that upon seeking the kingdom of God everything that I desire will automatically be given? Not quiet, there is something about seeking the kingdom of God that changes YOU to know who He is and who you are in relation to Him. I remember when I was young we would not be quick to take the corn flour and make corn bread with it. We had a sieve we used to sift the flour before we could use it. The interesting thing about the sieve, it let the good flour pass through as we shook it and retained little chunks, husks, little sand we missed seeing left in the sieve. The sieve separated what was acceptable and rejected.

This is true with the word of God, as you are seeking His kingdom first and His righteousness, what you are doing is setting your life in prayer and His word to be shaken to sift through what is acceptable. Proverbs 10:32, tells us “The lips of the righteous know what is ACCEPTABLE”. How will you know what is acceptable if you are not sifted through prayer and His word?

Had you not been sifted, you would have not known that things like pride, stinginess, unforgiveness, fear, doubt, anger to mention a few were lingering in your life and what you desired would be a stumbling
block if given unless God first dealt with what was left in the sieve. Now I understand why some things I prayed for did not come to pass or were delayed, God did not want the blessing to be a stumbling block. I
did not have a stronger character to support what He wanted to do. I did not let my life be sifted first. Had I been to the sieve first, I would have known what I needed God to work on in my life before asking
what I desired of Him in line with His will for my life. I want to be formed first before I can be filled, I hope that is your prayer but first we will not know until we have been in the sieve.

Good morning,

“Then the LORD said to Noah, “Come into the ark, you and all your household, because I have seen that you are righteous before Me in this generation…So those that entered, male and female of all flesh, went in as God had commanded him; and the LORD shut him in.” (Gen 7:1, 16).

In Divine Movement part one we looked at how God moved Mary and Joseph from Nazareth to Bethlehem that the Scripture might be fulfilled, “But you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, though you are little among the thousands of Judah, yet out of you shall come forth to Me the One to be Ruler in Israel, whose goings forth are from of old, from everlasting (Micah
5:2).”  God moved the earthly parents of Christ to carry out God’s Divine plan for Christ.  I recently received a touching testimony from
someone that shared that she believes at this time that God is divinely moving her to a new location which seems, untimely, senseless, and difficult.

Imagine what Noah must have felt like as perhaps the first person to experience God’s Divine movement.  Noah is instructed to build an ark.

Noah, had never seen an ark before, and although God gave him the blueprints for the project it also had never rained before.  At this time in history there was a water canopy that covered the earth which God would tear open “the windows of heaven” as release upon the earth.
God decides that He is going to flood the whole world, and that he would save Noah, his family, and a host of animals, all because of the righteousness of Noah.  Who could say that God doesn’t notice ones character?  It was not Noah’s works of building the ark that saved
Noah, but it was God’s grace that saved Noah as Noah’s character pleased God.

When I was reading this account in Genesis, I saw something that I had never seen before.  At the end of the verse of Genesis 7:16, it reads, “…and the Lord shut him in.”  It sounds to me that since their was
no one that was going along with Noah before the flood took place, other than his family, there was no one that would have shut Noah into the ark.  No one supported Noah in God’s Divine movement upon his life.  I think it is safe to say that this shows us that there will be times when God will move you in a direction that many will not understand, or support you in because frankly they have not seen or heard of anyone doing what you feel that God is calling you to do.

John 21:15-19, 17″The third time he said to him, “Simon son of John,
do you love me?” Peter was hurt because Jesus asked him the third
time, “Do you love me?” He said, “Lord, you know all things; you know
that I love you.” (NIV)

If you are anything like me, being told to do something more than once can be irritating. To me this can be assign that I did not hear you the first time or you don’t trust that I can or will do it. What happens when the Lord tells you something more than once, what would your attitude be?

If you remember when Jesus was arrested, before then Peter said he would never deny Christ and Jesus said to him in Matthew 26:34, “Assuredly, I say to you that this night, before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.” (NIV). He did not realize what he had done until the third time that it clicked to him of what Jesus had said to him. Now Jesus has come back to life, ready to go to heaven and He is giving His final charge to Peter. In other words, Jesus was reinstating (restoring) the one time weak Peter, getting him ready for greater things he had not thought about or imagined. He was establishing the word He had told the disciples earlier in John 14:12 when He said, “Most assuredly, I say to you, he who believes in Me, the works that I do he will do also; and greater works than these he will do, because I go to My Father.

He says “Simon son of John, do you love me?” Peter was hurt because Jesus asked him the third time, “Do you love me?” He said, “Lord, you know all things; you know that I love you. Remember Peter kept on responding saying “you know I love you. Starting from the book of Acts you see a restored bold wonder working Peter, 1 John 4:18, There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear, because fear involves torment”. He still was still learning because again three times God tried to speak to him through a vision about a mission field, he could not understand what the vision meant until much later. We may be slow to learn but I pray we will retain. Lord provoke us to zeal.

Good morning,

1Samuel 1:1-28, vs. 6 “And her rival (Peninnah) also provoked her (Hannah) severely, to make her miserable, because the LORD had closed her womb. 7 So it was, year by year, when she went up to the house of the LORD, that she provoked her; therefore she wept and did not eat”

It is fascinating to note that whenever God is getting ready to do something, He will use the unexpected. Unless you know God’s ways like Moses did rather than His acts, you will see things in away that will not make sense and if you are not careful, what is suppose to grow may  break you simply because you have not taken time to understand the reason for its existence at a particular time. If you don’t understand Romans 8:28, which says  “And we know that all things WORK TOGETHER for good to those who love God, to those who are the called according to His purpose” you will not understand the reason why. Two striking words out of the vs. “work together” which I take it to mean God taking the pieces of what is present, combining them (even from the enemy) and making something extraordinary out of it. Think of it this way, the ingredients of a cake not all taste good individually but when mixed and worked together, they have the capability of making the cake taste good.

Based on the introduction to my message, let’s now look at the book of 1st Samuel which introduces us to Elkanah and his two wives, Penninah and Hannah. continuing to read, Elkanah loved Hannah more than Penninah. As you can it’s the Lord who closed her womb and not out of the natural causes. Could it be possible that God closed her womb because He was controlling the timing in which He would allow her to have a child? I believe so. Maybe God wanted Hannah not just to have a child for the sake of having a child but a child with destiny and the timing had to be perfect. Maybe she longed for a child and since she already discovered that she was barren, she did not see any reason to believe that anything else could happen. Maybe she got to that place of contentment with what she had, a husband who loved her and cared for her. Maybe she concluded that she had attained all she could ever attain in life then here comes Penninah her rival.

The bible says Penninah began to provoke her. If you read the passage, you may feel like despising Penninah because of her cruelty to Hannah but when you understand God’s ways according to Romans 8:28, you will go on your knees and thank God for Penninah. Who is Penninah? Penninah is the instrument God would use to awaken the dream and desire God had placed at a certain time and the timing is right for it to provoked to zeal. The timing was right, the desire to have a child may have not been in Hannah and here comes Penninah rubbing Hannah the wrong way which awakened something in Hannah.

Because of Penninah, Hannah began to pray more, spend time in the presence of God, pour out her heart to the Lord, longed again for a child, prayed to God for a child. Year after year she prayed. Even though her prayers were not being answered at the time she wanted them answered, all things were working together for her good. The more she sought, the more she learnt how to pray and pray effectively. I believe her character was being enlarged. Her attitude changed from Lord give me a child so that I’m not left out to give me and I will give him back to you for service.

Your rival is not an enemy as the world would make you believe, your
rival is an awakening tool God will use to raise you up. When a
Penninah shows us, let it be a clear sign that you are being provoked
to zeal. Maybe nothing else could make you pray like you need to,
read, witness, go extra mile until a Penninah is introduced. Yes
Penninah may rub you the wrong way but as I already mentioned, ALL
THINGS WORK TOGETHER FOR GOOD. Who is your Peninnah?

Happy New Year,

1Kings 19:19-21, “Then Elijah passed by him and threw his mantle on him”

Will take a couple of days to share messages to prep us for the new year starting with this one.

The Almighty God works and speaks to people differently, for some of us who get so much distracted, He mostly speaks to us through other people, bill boards, signs, His word that we do not loose touch with Him. Anytime God is getting ready to do something greater in my life, He will send someone my way that will provoke me to zeal and I will desire what they have so as to accomplish what the Lord wants me to accomplish. Through learning from the Lord that away, I tend to provoke many believers to awaken their zeal, desire more and realize they have a potential God desires to awaken.

Elijah the Tishbite is a prophet God had used mightily, his time on earth was almost gone and he had to find his successor. God tells him to anoint two new kings and a prophet. The prophet to be will be under his ministry until he is taken away. I love the way Elijah did it. Just before then, let’s look at the man who will take over from him, Elisha, “he was plowing with twelve yoke of oxen”, was involved in the family business. He is in charge, in control, he is the boss but when Elijah meets him, Elijah provokes him not by what he said but by what he did, “threw his mantle on him”. I never get any where without being provoked to zeal. I have friends, preachers who have provoked me through the area of intercessions, witnessing, doing memory verses, teaching, preaching and I can do all these things because someone provoked me. Just like Elisha, I wasn’t provoked necessarily by what they said, I was provoked by what I saw and that laid a mantle upon me. Without being provoked to zeal, you loose your edge. The reason for provoking is to awaken you to the fact that there is more and it’s not impossible to achieve or get there when you know who you are in Christ and understand His will for your life. What touched Elisha’s body awakened him to a greater calling and he desired to walk with Elijah. What provoked you to get to where you are?

1Kings 19:21, “So Elisha turned back from him, and took a yoke of oxen and slaughtered them and boiled their flesh, using the oxen’s equipment, and gave it to the people, and they ate. Then rose and followed Elijah, and became his servant”. What a touch to cause him to kiss everything he had held dear goodbye for the sake of the call. He had a good business and was content until it was clear through Elijah that there was more. I have seen people called and provoked of God to sell all their belongings, move to a land where no one wanted to go because of the call. This is not of man, this is of God. Elisha could kiss everything good bye because God had already hand picked him. When the calling comes, no going back!!!. It’s interesting to note that he might have not known what he was getting himself into but what he saw and felt couldn’t be rubbed off, he is following as a servant, watching what the Lord is doing through Elijah. His observation builds a hunger and thirst for what Elijah had.

In 2Kings chapter 2, Elisha knows that Elijah will be taken away, this is the man he had been following, the man by which he kissed everything goodbye. The sons of the prophets had reminded him that Elijah will be history soon, then after crossing river Jordan, Elijah asked him 2Kings 2:9, “…Ask! what may I do for you, before I am taken away from you? and Elisha said, “Please let a double portion of your spirit (anointing) be upon me”. Provoked to desire double portion of the anointing. This is calling for double portion of Elijah’s responsibilities while he was on earth. SEE THE ANOINTING IS NOT TO MAKE YOU POWERFUL, THE ANOINTING IS TO EMPOWER YOU TO GET YOU TO WORK FOR HIM. You and I are provoked to get more so as to put that more to work. When God used these people to provoke me to desire more, that meant I was calling for more responsibilities. vs. 10, “So he said, “You have asked for a hard thing, Nevertheless, if you see me when I am taken away from you, it will be so for you … vs. 14, “then the mantle of Elijah that had fallen from him and struck the water, … and when he also had struck the water, it was divided this way and that; and Elisha crossed”. Now he could understand that when Elijah threw his mantle on him, that anointing that woke him up is what he needed, when Elijah said when you see me go up it’s yours, someone would think that he would bow and pray for him to receive it but what happened is that his mantle was left behind. Where Elijah was going, he did not need the mantle that represented the anointing. Elisha did more miracles than Elijah, Jesus said, “Greater works than this shall ye do, for I am going to the Father”. The disciples were provoked to zeal and when they were anointed, they put that anointing to work. Do you have people who provoke you to zeal in prayers, witnessing, teaching, preaching, etc? Don’t loose your edge!!!!

Thanks

Good morning,

“When Herod the king heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.”

What causes you to get angry? Perhaps there are certain situations or people that seem to cause anger to rise up in you. According to the Scriptures anger alone is not a sin. The Scriptures says, be angry and sin not or in your anger do not sin. One thing that seems to make most people excited however is the birth of a child. When a child is born many come to see the newborn and rejoice with the family to whom the child has been born. However, can you picture any reason why one would become angry because of a newborn? This was the response of King Herod to the news of the birth of Jesus Christ.

Matthew tells us, “Now after ?Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, ??wise men ?from the East came to Jerusalem, ?2 saying, ??“Where is He who has been born King of the Jews? For we have seen His star in the East and have come to worship Him.” Why would these Magi which had had traveled from the East, most likely from Persia, first go to King Herod the Roman King to inquire of the newborn Jewish King? Where else would one go to find a King but in a palace? However, God in His Divine Providence moved Christ to safety because God knew of the mutiny that Herod plotted against Jesus. Matthew describes the response of Herod about the news of Jesus’ birth, “When Herod the king heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him. What was it that caused King Herod to become angry and troubled and ALL JERUSALEM WITH HIM?!?! At this time Herod was the King, although he himself was not Jewish he was the King of the Jews as the Jewish people were under Roman authority.

The Expositor’s Bible Commentary explains that, “In contrast with the Magi’s desire to worship the King of the Jews, Herod is deeply troubled. In this “all Jerusalem” joins him, not because most of the people would have been sorry to see Herod replaced or because they were reluctant to see the coming of King Messiah, but because they well knew that any question like the Magi’s would result in more cruelty from the ailing Herod, whose paranoia had led him to murder his favorite wife and two sons.” WOW, a King that murdered his own wife and sons, no wonder he had no problem desiring to murder the new born King, the Son of God! Hatred is murder of the heart according to God as John wrote, “Whoever hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life abiding in him.” Herod did not want to be replaced, and the people did not wish to experience Herod’s killing tirade as he plays no favorites when it comes to murder. If Christ were to take the throne and be crowned King, what would that mean for Herod?

1. Herod would no longer be King

2. The Jews would now look to their own King

3. The authority Herod had over the Jews would now be passed to Jesus

4. Jerusalem would no longer be under the rule of Herod but under the rule of Jesus

In the natural I can see why Herod was troubled and angry of this newborn King. This would mean King Herod would be out, and King Jesus would sit on the throne in Jerusalem.

Christ’s desires to have the natural sinful Herod heart off the throne, and for Him to have rule and reign over your life. Do you worship like the Magi or become troubled, angry and rebellious like Herod as Christ assumes Kingship over your life. Perhaps today is a day of humble repentance for you. As you examine your response to King Jesus, is it truly one of worship or is Herod’s heart beating in your life?

Until the nets are filled…

Blessings,

Pastor Phil <><

Good morning,

“And it came to pass in those days that a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be registered. ?2? ??This census first took place while Quirinius was governing Syria. ?3? So all went to be registered, everyone to his own city. (Luke 2:1).

Have you ever had the “joy” of moving? There was a season in my life where I had to move four times in four years. This was certainly not fun. I recall the day getting home from our honeymoon, that my wife and I were blessed to be introduced, through my in-laws, to see our current apartment. The only slight dilemma was that I had just moved all of my things, prior to our honeymoon, into another apartment. This would mean more moving, but it was certainly worth it. Although it was only temporary, Mary and Joseph had to move from Nazareth to Bethlehem. However in doing so one can see how God moves one or a group of people from one place to another to accomplish His will and Divine Plan.

The prophecy was foretold by the Prophet Micah, “But you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, though you are little among the thousands of Judah, yet out of you shall come forth to Me the One to be Ruler in Israel, whose goings forth are from of old, from everlasting (5:2).” Obviously according to the prophecy, Christ had to be born in Bethlehem, but the only problem was that Mary and Joseph were living in Nazareth at the time. How was this prophecy to be fulfilled if Christ was in the wrong place? God would orchestrate the circumstances to assure that His Son would be born precisely in the place where the Prophet had prophesied.

Luke wrote, “And it came to pass in those days that a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be registered. ?2? ??This census first took place while Quirinius was governing Syria. ?3? So all went to be registered, everyone to his own city. (Luke 2:1).” Perhaps you’ve read this around many times, especially recently with the Christmas season being upon us. However here are some awesome facts. In Matthew 1, the genealogy is paternal, going through Jesus’ earthly father, Joseph; and Joseph’s father, Jacob; back to David. In Luke 3, the genealogy is maternal, going through Jesus’ mother, Mary; and Mary’s father, Heli; back to David. Hence the census called by the ungodly and polytheistic Romans, caused Mary and Joseph to be forced to go to Bethlehem together, because both were from the line of King David, were Christ was to be born. The Roman IRS did not care that Mary was pregnant, and there was no other reason for Joseph to take his espoused Mary on a long journey from Nazareth to Bethlehem. God has an awesome way of orchestrating things to carry out His Divine Plan. If events at the dawn of the first century had progressed just ordinarily, Jesus would not have been born in Bethlehem. But God orchestrated the events of that time, and thus worked in amazing and powerful ways to make the Lord’s birth occur precisely at the right time and place, thus verifying His own prophetic Word. There are many times when perhaps like Joseph the movement that is taking place in our lives seems senseless, untimely, unpopular, and very emotional in our estimation. However Joseph and Mary followed the Lord, and walked His plan out even unknowingly. It must have been a difficult journey, but following God is not a road without bumps and unexpected turns.

Today, examine how God is moving you to accomplish his will in your life at this time. Perhaps He is moving you in such a way that is unpopular, senseless, and “untimely” in your eyes, but it is His Will.

Until the nets are filled…

Blessings,

Pastor Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“We are therefore Christ’s ambassadors, as though God were making his appeal through us. We implore you on Christ’s behalf: Be reconciled to God.” 2 Corinthians 5:20

Merry CHRISTmas! I love saying that. We live in an age where the world wants us to be culturally tolerant, and politically correct. All other religious “holidays” are not really holidays if we agree that the word holiday is really the word HOLY DAY. How is Kwanza, or Ramadan holy? Kwanza does not focus on Christ, because the focus is on culture and man not on Christ the Lord. Then of course there are those that are professing Christians that go to a church, maybe place a manger scene somewhere in our homes, perhaps even have “Jesus the reason for the season” somewhere around. What is this whole thing really about? There is a well known Christmas song that says Hark the herald angels sing, “Glory to the newborn King! Peace on earth and mercy mild God and sinners reconciled” What does that mean for God and sinners to be reconciled? Consider the lyrics by Go Fish called “It’s about the Cross.”

It’s not just about the manger, Where the baby lay, It’s not all about the angels Who sang for him that day, It’s not just about the shepherds , Or the bright and shining star It’s not all about the wise men, Who traveled from afar

Chorus: It’s about the cross, It’s about my sin, It’s about how Jesus came to be born once So that we could be born again, It’s about the stone, That was rolled away, So that you and I could have real life someday, It’s about the cross, It’s about the cross

Verse 2: It’s not just about the presents, underneath the tree, It’s not all about the feeling That the season brings to me, It’s not just about coming home, To be with those you love It’s not all about the beauty, In the snow I’m dreaming of

The beginning of the story is wonderful and great, But it’s the ending that can save you and that’s why we celebrate, It’s about the cross, It’s about my sin, It’s about how Jesus came to be born once, So that we could be born again

It’s about God’s love, Nailed to a tree, It’s about every drop of blood that flowed from Him when it should have been me, It’s about the stone, That was rolled away, So that you and I could have real life someday, So that you and I could have real life someday, It’s about the cross, It’s about the cross.

Jesus was born to die for the Law that you and I have broken (God’s 10 Commandments). Jesus Christ was born of a women, born of a virgin, lived a life of perfection and went to the cross for you and I. When one looks at how far one is, how one has violated God’s perfect standard of righteousness, it makes God’s love amazing. Have you been reconciled or made right with God? Have you confessed and forsaken (turned away from) your sins and put your trust in Christ like you would trust in a parachute. If you have be sure to thank God and Go, as Christ has commanded, and begin to tell your friends, family members and even strangers about the cross. Acts 4:12 reads, “Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.” Only Christ provided a payment for sin. If you’ve never repented and trust Christ, humble yourself and do that today, because eternity is a long time, actually its eternal. May those who are reading this be reconciled to God, and be used to share the truth for others to be reconciled to God.

Blessings,

Pastor Phil <><

Exodus 3:1-22, “Come now therefore, and I will send thee unto Pharaoh, that thou mayest bring forth my people the children of Israel out of Egypt”

We have looked at the FORMING and SANCTIFICATION, this morning will look at ORDAINING.

Eccle 3:14, “I know that whatever God does, It shall be forever. Nothing can be added to it, And nothing taken from it. God does it, that men should fear before Him. What God is working on nothing can be added to it and nothing can be taken away from it, it is complete. I believe that anytime God is getting ready to raise someone, everything that once mattered in their lives begins to fade away and like Paul you will call them dung. Good morning,

1Timothy 2:8, “I will therefore that men pray everywhere, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting”

One of the struggles in our lives as believers is having a prayer life. I have heard men mightily used of God confess that struggle too. Let’s see what God has for us.

Prayer is not reserved for church only in the sense that I don’t have to wait to go to church to pray and when I am out of the church, prayer ceases. Prayer is essential in our walk with God. Mark this word, “God does not need prayers to make Him God, we need prayers to be like God” for we are His children.

Prayers is not easy the reason I believe it’s not a want but a need. When Jesus knew that His time for crucifixion was getting near, He went to the mountain  as usual to pray and He brought with Him Peter, James and John as usual, left them somewhere to pray while He went further to another division of the mountain to pray. He prayed faithfully there but when He came back, He found the three sleeping and He asked, “could you wait (pray) with me for even an hour?”. If it was tough for the disciples to pray, we are not exempt from it. We should pray for it’s a commandment from God and there are other things that go with prayer. Look at what Jesus tells the disciples Matt 26:39, “Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed is willing but the flesh is weak”. He understood that for these guys to stand during the trying times they were about to face, they needed to pray at the same time He also knew that their spirit was willing but their flesh was too weak. Thank God that the spirit is willing and now the flesh has to be crucified that the willing spirit may concur the unwilling flesh. The flesh does not like the idea of prayers but it needs it to escape temptations, needs it for provision, guidance, protection to mention a few.

1Timothy 2:8, “I will therefore that men pray everywhere, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting”. This scripture eliminates any mentality that prayer is reserved for a particular place. I pray sometimes when I am driving for I am less distracted, I pray effectively when I go to church, in rare cases do I pray at home because of distractions. Do you pray? how often do you pray? where do you pray?. I don’t pray because I want to but because I need to and there are so many times my spirit is willing but my flesh is weak and tries by all means to stop the spirit. If we can starve the flesh, we can feed the spirit. When I say starve the flesh, I don’t mean don’t eat but don’t give it the other things that it’s craving for. Many years ago while working at a food store as a cashier, I would do a lot of prayers while serving my customers especially when I saw one depressed, no joy, looking sickly. One day a woman came to the store and after she had come to my line, I looked up and there she was looking depressed and sick, as I looked at her face, I saw a big wound on her nose it was like her nose was rotting so I began to pray for her mumbling words while ringing her stuff. After she had given me her money and I had given her stuff, I continued to pray for her as I was serving the next customer. After a couple of weeks, she came to the store to shop then came to my line again but this time with a smile and looking up, I saw that the wound on her nose was gone and only a scar was left to see. I smiled back at her and served her while she asked me, “how come you are smiling” and I said, “because your wound is gone”. She had no idea that I prayed for her when she was sick and depressed. Prayer is powerful and it’s effective anywhere if it is offered. Like I always say, Prayer paves a way for God to move.

Acts 6:4, “But we will give ourselves to prayer, and to the ministry of the word”, when you talk about prayers, the book of acts has a lot of the word prayer in it and it’s simply because the people of the early church devoted themselves to prayer, fasting, breaking of bread and fellowshipping and I can tell that is the reason the church in those days were very powerful and effective. People of today want to see God move and yet do not want to pray and I am guilty of this too, but if we want to see God move, see sinners saved, see the sick get healed, marriages restored, children protected, teenagers live right, we got to pray. Look at what Acts 6:4 puts it, “But we will give ourselves to prayers, and to the ministry of the word”. Let’s give ourselves to prayers, praying everywhere, seeking the kingdom of God, praying thy Kingdom come, thy will be done and praying for other people. 2Chronicles 7:14, “If my people which are called by my name shall humble themselves and pray, and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven and forgive their sins and heal their land”. Start praying today, give yourself to prayer.

title.rendered: THE EVANGELIST’S KRYPTONITE, by Darrel Rundus, Founder/President of The Great News Network

content.rendered:
Good morning,

The much more dangerous trappings of our pride are the ones that are usually less obvious. While they are usually tougher to spot by others, they are easily identified if you are willing to look at yourself with sober judgment and a tender conscience. Here are a few things to ask yourself to see if you suffer from the subtle signs of pride. When writing a story, completing a project or doing something for someone else, do you inwardly crave the positive comments or praise from people? Do you normally concern yourself with what other people will think or say about something you’ve said or done instead of focusing on doing what you do unto the Lord? When someone shares something good that’s happened in their life are you genuinely happy for them or do you feel as if it should’ve happened to you or that it’s nothing compared to the great things you’ve seen God do in your life? Do you really listen and take a sincere interest to what others say or do you just wait until it’s your turn to talk? Do you find yourself inwardly being critical of other Christians or your pastor when they don’t embrace your views of evangelism? Do you esteem yourself more highly than you ought to or feel like you’re better than most other Christians because you share your faith and they don’t? Are you reluctant to ask someone for help or advice because you think you can do it yourself or you’ll figure it out on your own? Do you find yourself reluctant to be a part of a group because you may not get your way? Maybe you think you don’t need to be part of the group (GNN, the Church, etc.) to share your faith because you can do just as well on your own? Or occasionally do you find yourself feeling vindicated when someone else is proven wrong? When you open-air preach do you find yourself wishing the crowd was bigger or constantly focusing on finding new ways to build a bigger crowd? I’m sure if you think and pray about it for a while, God will reveal to you the elements of pride (if any) in your life.

Satan relentlessly uses pride as a powerful weapon to weaken, incapacitate and ultimately destroy the Evangelist (When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom. – Proverbs 11:2). Almost always and without exception, when an Evangelist stumbles or falls it can be traced back to their pride. Whether it’s obvious or subtle, pride has a way of creeping into our lives and inhibiting us from being led by the spirit of God and ultimately leads to our demise (Before his downfall a man’s heart is proud, but humility comes before honor – Proverbs 18:12). The single biggest thing any Evangelist must be on constant guard against is their pride.

How do you fend off the arrows of arrogance and pride that the enemy will surely shoot at you? How do you remain free from your pride and sidestep the sin of self righteousness? The antidote to your pride is to always give God all of the glory, trust not in yourself but acknowledge Him in all things and love others as much or more than you love yourself (Blessed is the man who makes the LORD his trust, who does not look to the proud, to those who turn aside to false gods – Psalm 40:4). One thing that love is not is proud! If you want to remain humble in your walk, focus on the grace and mercy that God showed you when He saved your soul from Hell (see James 4 & Philippians 2). Count all your blessings and then recall all the sins that you’ve been forgiven of. Remember, he who has been forgiven much, loves much (Luke 7:47).

I think a great biblical illustration of the attitude an Evangelist should try to maintain and how to do it is when the seventy-two returned from witnessing. They were all proud, pumped up and boasting about how they had power over the demons. Jesus’ response to them was “â€¦do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven” – Luke 10:20. This is a perfect example of how to be bold in your witness while remaining humble in your walk. Don’t think or boast about the power God’s given you over the circumstances of life, others or even the enemy. Just be grateful that by God’s grace you’re headed for Heaven! Another great thing any Evangelist can do to fend off their pride is to surround yourself with others who will help to keep you accountable to humility and those who understand how to recognize the tell-tale signs of pride (see – 1 Peter 5).

So, the next time you’re feeling like Superman and start thinking you’re invincible and nothing can stop you, examine yourself to see if there’s any Kryptonite (pride) hiding in the lead box of your heart.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Most everyone knows that if you want to defeat the all-powerful DC comic book character Superman; somewhere, sometime, somehow Kryptonite will come into play. This is the only weakness of the Man of Steel. He may be faster than a speeding bullet, stronger than a mighty locomotive and able to leap tall buildings with a single bound; but when faced with Kryptonite, he becomes incapacitated and weak.

Every Evangelist I know also has such a weakness. Pride is to the Evangelist what Kryptonite is to Superman. While pride is destructive to anyone and everyone, it’s particularly a problem for most Evangelists. You see, if Satan can’t stop you from sharing your faith and teaching others to do the same, he’ll try to make you proud that you’re doing it! Yes, the all-powerful mighty Evangelist may be able to dodge the arrows from the enemy, quote scriptures faster than a TV preacher, jump over the traps that Satan sets and even have the ability to face their fears and boldly proclaim the gospel of Christ in a flash, but when confronted with the issues of pride, just like Superman, they become incapacitated and weak. Make no mistake about it, the fast track to fruitlessness as an Evangelist is to follow the path of pride (A man’s pride brings him low, but a man of lowly spirit gains honor – Proverbs 29:23).

I find it interesting that if they truly want to be fruitful for the Lord, the Evangelist must be bold in their witness, but remain humble in their walk. What’s interesting about that, you ask? The two characteristics (boldness & humility) are polar opposites. To be brave enough to face the wicked ways of the enemy and approach people with the message that has the power to save their soul from hell while walking the righteous road of humility is not an easy thing to do. Pride is a strange thing in that sometimes, the signs are obvious while all too often, the signs of pride in our life are not so easy to see. Ironically, when we are blinded by our pride, the pride itself causes us to refuse to even admit that we have a problem with pride in our lives. The fact that some who will read this will say, “This doesn’t apply to me, I’m not prideful!” is proof positive that they most likely struggle with some elements of pride in their life (If anyone thinks he is something when he is nothing, he deceives himself. Each one should test his own actions. Then he can take pride in himself, without comparing himself to somebody else, for each one should carry his own load – Galatians 6:3-5).

What are some of the indicators that you may struggle with pride? As I already mentioned, some of the signs are obvious while others are not. Refusing to listen to others who offer Godly or biblical advice, insisting you are right on a regular basis, not being quick to forgive others or to ask for forgiveness, outwardly being critical of others, being argumentative and boasting or bragging about what a great Evangelist you are or how many souls you’ve won to the Lord are a few obvious signs of pride. As an open- air preacher, I used to find myself boasting about how big the crowd was or when I heard about someone else preaching and asking, “How big was the crowd?” All these as well as many others are things that should make it easy to see that your pride has become a stumbling block to you, your walk with the Lord and your efforts as an Evangelist.

To be continued

Good morning,

Isaiah 41:15, “Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth: thou shall thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and shall make thee hills of chaff.

Life is full of up and downs, a lot of challenges to go with it. There are days you feel like you are winning and there are days when you feel like a failure. Often times I have used the word “season modes” for every season presents it’s weather and everyone has to learn to adapt in every season otherwise you become a victim. At times even the preachers go dry, and they are left with no power and no strength to fight the good fight of a soldier. If the preachers, pastors, deacons, board members, evangelists are not exempt from the dry and burn outs it is a bad thing, though some may not agree with me, but I don’t want to be perfect!!!!. perfect people don’t need help. God may take you through a process and when you think you now have everything in place to make you perfect, He will relocate you again for His purpose is not to make you confident in yourself but confident in Him.

We are all instrument of a kind designed and made by God. Each instrument has been made for a specific purpose cannot accomplish what it was never designed to do. Let’s look at some other words for “instruments”, a tool, device, gadget, utensil, apparatus, appliance. Let me take the word tool and make use of it. Any tool that need sharpening needs it before it can effectively be used. A sharpened tool will give you a better result compared to a blunt tool. Not only will a sharp tool give you a better result, it will make the work faster and easier and less energy will be required to have the job done. You can not force a lawn mower to trim the fence, it was never designed for that. Each and every tool was designed for a specific task and so is with every believer, we are designed for specific tasks, callings and ministries and we cannot go around trying to do everything that we were never called to do. I was never called to sing, therefore I don’t need to appear at a choir practice for I will mess up everything. When you know what you have been called to do, you will not just have a passion for it but you will also be good at it. God has invested in each of us diversified gifts to be utilized for we are His instrument but….

Every instrument used at times get out of place, and has to be tuned, sharpened, oiled, repaired and the like and the Lord is saying to us in Isaiah 41:15, “Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth”. “Behold”, not only is He telling you and I to observe, watch, see, take a look at, view but He is also telling those around us to watch. You can be effective, but there comes a time when your effectiveness reduces and you have to come back to the one who is using you as the tool for sharpening. Watch the way He puts it, “I will make thee”, If He does not do it, it cannot be done; if He does not fix it, it cannot be fixed, therefore we call on Him to sharpen our lives when we go blunt. I just checked and another word for blunt is dull. Blunt tools don’t look attractive and most of the time, they have dents on the blade and are rusty. When you begin to sharpen it, expect it to sparkle. All the dents will diminish, it will shine and the owner of the tool is happy about using a sharpened tool. He is sharpening it because He wants to use it and not put in display.

Our prayer lives, witnessing skills, reading of the word, faith, hope, working skills, wisdom, passions, dreams, desires, relationships need to be sharpened. I know in this group there are tools designed by God that have become dull, dormant, rusty and blunt. Someone looks like an old, beaten tool that has been abused in the hands of the wrong person. You’ve lost your effectiveness, you’ve tried hard to be used but because you are blunt, more energy is used to make something out of it. The sign of the anointing is when you can take less and do much with it, Holy Ghost knows how to sharpen us and put us back to work. Regardless of what size the tool is, when it’s sharpened and used in the right field in which it was designed for, watch and you will see marvelous results. He says again in Isaiah 41:15, “… thou shall thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and shall make thee hills of chaff”. What a description of what will happen when you and I are sharpened, for we will thresh the mountains and beat them small. Remember when David was sharpened, his mountain was Goliath and because he was sharp in the word of the Lord, he threshed his mountains when Saul who was blunt at this time and could not even lift up his head to say a word. We thank Him for His word is our sharpener. Where in your life have you gone blunt, mark that it’s not beginning but you already had it before and it was effective at one point but in the process of time, you, the tool fell in wrong hands that abused you as a tool or you were in the right hand but you lost your effectiveness and now you are blunt and dull, you have dent’s all over and anything you try to do is yielding less strength or no strength. Jump into the Lord’s workshop and let Him sharpen you again. He wants to use you, but with you blunt, you will not be effective.

Good morning,

Luke 7:1-9, And when they came to Jesus, they besought him instantly, saying, That he was worthy for whom he should do this: (KJV)

A story is told of a little girl who looked outside the window of her house and saw a sheep and wondered how that sheep looked so white and clean. While still looking at the sheep, all of a sudden it started snowing. Before long, the sheep that looked white and clean did not appear clean anymore because the white crystal snow overshadowed the whiteness of the sheep and the girl thought how dirty that sheep looked in the light of the snow. Looking at it closely, you can see that she sheep did not change, the girl saw it under different background, that is what made the difference.

In line with the story above, Jesus entered Capernaum and we are told  that a certain centurion had a servant who was sick. As you read more into the story, you discover that the centurion was a man in authority and under authority. He had servants and he commanded them and they listened and responded. He loved his nation and had built a synagogue so he had a good resume. When he sent the elders of the Jews to speak to Jesus about his sick servant, the elders did not hesitate. They went to Jesus and even gave Jesus a good word about him. They talked highly of him and felt that he was WORTHY to receive healing for his servant. What strikes me is that they felt that he DESERVED Jesus attention because of who he was and what he had done. People were elevating him. In the background of his nation, he was a worthy man.

6 Then Jesus went with them. And when He was already not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to Him, saying to Him, “Lord, do not trouble Yourself, for I am not WORTHY that You should enter under my roof. How is it that a man who every one thought was worthy considers himself un worthy? Simple,  the background of the presence of the Son of God overshadowed his worthiness and he saw him as that dirty sheep that looked clean before the snow came about. Of all the people, only Jesus was worthy. Revelation 5:2 Then I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, “Who is worthy to open the scroll and to loose its seals?” 3 And no one in heaven or on the earth or under the earth was able to open the scroll, or to look at it. 4 So I wept much, because no one was found worthy to open and read the scroll, or to look at it. 5 But one of the elders said to me, “Do not weep. Behold, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has prevailed (WORTHY) to open the scroll and to loose its seven seals.” When no one was found worthy, He was found worthy. The centurion knew that he did not deserve to have Jesus, the worthy one come to him or his house. The centurion continues to speak of his unworthiness, in verse 7 Therefore I did not even think myself worthy to come to You. His unworthiness humbled him to develop such a great faith on the one who was worthy. And we know his servant was healed because of the faith he had.

When I think about my life and how so unworthy I was, reduced to worthless in His sight, I’m humbled. People buy things that are worth something, He bought me with the highest price when I was worthless. Now I am worth something, not because of me but because of Him (WORTHY) who lives in me. I will enter into heaven not on the basis of my worthiness but on His. I thank Him for the chance to see myself in His background and not the background of men that I might repent and put my trust in Him alone for my eternal salvation.

Thanks

Good morning,

2Kings 5:1-19, “…Please let him come to me, and he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel”

We established a statement yesterday about the strength of the cure is not in the messenger but in the seed of the cure in other words the MESSAGE. Let’s see some neat things we could learn from the story.

Already the man has been told that there is a prophet in Samaria who by God’s power can heal leprosy, the first mistake he makes, he goes to his king who writes a letter to the king of Israel asking him to heal his servant in vs. 6. Wait a minute, wasn’t he told that there was a prophet in Samaria? Here is my thinking, since he was a leader with power, he would rather deal with another leader, a king for it was the typical thing to do why?, because everyone operated in different classes and ranks and so people could only do business with the people of their class. We at times do the same, at times we think that God had no understanding when He was using someone who is beneath us to accomplish His work. The bible says that God uses the foolish things to confound the mighty and despised to confound the wise that no flesh should glory in His presence.  God does things FOR US but it’s NOT ABOUT US. The whole reason He moves is for Him to be GLORIFIED.

The king of Israel is upset for he has no power to heal, he rents his clothes and feels like someone is on his case and wants to start a fight with him. Elisha hears about what had happened and he sends for Naaman, time for God to be glorified. I bet he had despised the prophets before but now he desperately needed help and the people he despised are the people God was going to use to reach out to him.

Here he comes with all the gold, clothing, and servants. He is ready to give gifts to anyone who will cure him of his disease, he has rehearsed exactly how he is going to be healed vs. 11 “Indeed, I said to myself, ‘He will surely come out to me, and stand and call on the name if the Lord his God, and wave his hand over the place, and heal the leprosy”. If God was to do everything the same way, I would think that we would want to dictate Him on how to do things and if it goes against the recipe we already know about God, we will be frustrated the same attitude Naaman had. Something interesting, Elisha did not even come out to see him, he sent his SERVANT to tell this big respected fellow go down to the river Jordan, wash himself seven times and he would be healed.  Naaman wanted to be healed in his way and being told something contrary what an insult according to him!.

Why Jordan a dirty river? Why not a touch, or a clean river or anything but that river.  It may appear that the healing was waiting for him in the river but that was not the case, “His healing was in his obedience to do what he had been asked to do”. He had servants and the kind of position he was holding, pride was really overwhelming him. But just like him unless we are ready to strip ourselves of the pride and arrogance, this will hinder what God wants to accomplish in us. Naaman was very upset that Elisha had the nerve to send a servant, mark the word (servant) to talk to him and the servant does not come with the cure but gives him instructions  to go and wash 7 times which is a number of perfection or completion. Believe me, whenever you need something from God, God might ask you to do a dumb thing and it will be upon you to decide to do it or not. You might be asked to forgive that person you don’t like or pray for the people who despitefully use you or give up something that was so dear to you. How you react and deal with it will determine the outcome. Abraham was tested and his blessings was in his obedience.

Try talking your way into changing the process and you will find that process surely stands still, Naaman had a choice either to swallow his pride and do it or let his ego take over and miss his healing. After persuasion from his servants he decides to do it anyway. Jumps six times and nothing happens, can you imagine him being frustrated for he has been doing the same thing over and over again yet nothing is happening? He had to jump the seventh time to complete the instructions given. When he jumped the seventh time, not only was his skin restored but he was given a better skin compared to what he had before he received leprosy. Eph 3:20, “Now unto Him who is able to do exceeding, abundantly above all we ask or imagine according to the power (power of obedience) that works within us”. From Naa-man (meaning no) to New-man, my own theory.

What’s my point this morning, two keys OBEDIENCE and PERSISTENT. Many want a blessing but they want it their way and when given away to receive it, they get frustrated at the first attempt or second. I encourage us this morning to be obedient to the word and fight all through till we receive it. At Your Word, I will do it for the outcome of it is in the obedience

Good morning,

2Kings 5:1-19, “…Please let him come to me, and he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel”

In the old and new testament days leprosy was considered as one of the most deadliest sickness known, infact the people who had leprosy were not allowed to live with the rest in the home. Most if not all  lived on the mountains and in the caves far from where everyone else lived until miraculously someone got healed then they would be allowed back in the home. In the story set before us today, we are told of a man by the name Naaman. This was no ordinary man for vs. 1 begins to describe him as a commander of the army of the king of Syria, great honorable man in the eyes of his master, he had received many victories as a warrior and he was a mighty man of valor. He was successful in every area of his life but one, he was a leper. How terrible, you have everything that causes you to be respected and admired but just one thing makes it difficult if not impossible to be complete. It’s not surprising that in the world we see people who have success in everything in life but down deep within their hearts they are leprous and their leprosy could be lack of peace, joy, a detected sickness, depression and you name it. This becomes a void in ones life, regardless of what they have, something to fill that void still misses. Some Christians also find themselves in this kind of dilemma because of a leprosy they have, it’s no surprise that some still suffer from depression, confusion, doubt, fear, anxiety, a memory, an incident and an accident and yet they are saved going to heaven. Regardless of how you have succeeded spiritually, materially or even socially, there is still one thing that you’ve got to deal with. I have been fighting the leprosy of fear for many years and still get to fight it even today, what are you fighting?

He who is sick needs a physician and when someone knows that there is cure, no matter who can offer it, they will receive the cure. Vs 3, talks about a little girl who had been brought back to Syria as slave from Israel. She was Namaan’s wife’s maid and being humble even in her afflictions she desired the best for her master. The little girl mentioned to Naaman’s wife about a prophet in Samaria who by God’s power could perform healing miracles to which she later mentioned to her husband. I would expect him to say, “what would a stupid slave girl know?”, but that was not the case for he listened to what the little girl had to say. This is a clear indication that when God is going to do something, He may use the least likely, the stones that the builders rejected for a simple reason, “THAT HE MAY RECEIVE ALL GLORY.

Mark this, The weight of the seed is not in the messenger but in the cure seed itself, receive it regardless of who brings it. If a word comes to you that it’s time to get out of a situation you have been in for long, believe it, receive it and act on it for the word is living and powerful, sharper than any double edged sword, piercing even division of heart and soul and of joints and marrows. The word is a discerner of thoughts and the intents of the heart, Hebrews 4:12

When you know there is a cure somewhere, you will not sit and do nothing, you will act on it. If I know what it will take to get it, I will go for it. I may cry for a while, get broken and be beaten by opinions but I will still fight the good fight of a soldier enduring shame as the elect of Christ.  Once it has been said and done I will come out. Broke, busted and disgusted but I am still coming out for I did not come this far to be the devil’s spare tire to be used when he has nothing better to do.  If it means praying and fasting, going an extra mile to get encouragements from friends and having someone stand with me, I will go for it for the strength of the cure is not in the messenger but in the cure seed.

To be continued

Thanks

Good morning friends,

Matthew 16:24 : “Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If
anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.”

It’s never easy to serve the Lord for there is a price to be paid and that is daily picking up the cross and following Him. The cross is never too easy to carry because of the magnitude of it’s weight, many times I stumble and fall while carrying the cross, even tempted to put it down then I’m reminded, soldiers don’t stop, don’t quit, don’t retreat or surrender. It’s daily dying to self for the sake of the call.

If a guy tells you, “if you are going to be my disciple, pick up your cross and follow me”, check what happened to Him when He picked up His cross and you will understand what will happen to you when you pick up yours. He was mocked, beaten, spat on, stressed out, exhausted but refused to put the cross down. If this happened to Him, don’t be surprised if the same happens to you for no one can expect to be treated  any better than Jesus. While carrying the cross, He wasn’t going down the hill, that would have been a little easy, He was climbing a hill that was high. I can imagine Him saying, “I’m going to hang on to it a little while that I might reach the top”. He is not doing it for Himself but for the sake of the people He loved. Someone wrote a song and said, “go a head and drive the nails in my hand, go a head and put it inside of me for after this I will rise again for no power on earth can hold me down”, Did He not say, “no man takes His life, he lays it down for the sake His my friends”. With this I keep fighting and if I fall (sin), I rise up again, ask for forgiveness, pick up the cross and follow Him saying, I will make it, I will survive, I will stand for if He did it, I can do it. This journey is not easy and it will never be easy no wander Paul tells us to run the race with patience looking unto Jesus the author and the finisher of our faith. “When my heart is overwhelmed, lead me to the rock (cross) that is higher than I”. It’s darker at dawn a sign that morning is around the corner. The bible says, “Joy comes in the morning”

Don’t give up fighting for it’s worth fighting in Christ, don’t stop living in Christ, don’t stop trusting and believing in Christ, don’t stop calling on Him for He is all you’ve got. Right now there are some struggling with different issues and at times you have felt like giving up. I want you to know that the Lord is on your side and if you will give Him a chance to guide and lead you, He will bring you to the place He wants you to be. Is it going to be easy, of course not but you have to be willing to take the stand. Discouraged, confused, broken, feel like giving up, stressed out, burdened by something, weak, fallen? you name it, check out how Christ made it and know that if He made it, you can make it too for the bible says we are more than conquerors which in other words means we conquer what has already been conquered. Joshua 1:5, “… as I was with Moses, so I will be with you”, as “I was with Jesus as He was going through the cross experience, so I will be with you in all that you go through”, says the Lord.
