title.rendered: Once Was Blind, But Now I see, Part 4

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mark 10:46-52, “…Rabboni, that I may receive my sight”.

Of the five keys in this passage hearing, initiating, obstacles, encouragement, and being specific, we covered the first three and today we will conclude by looking at the two remaining. So here we go.

Mark 10:50, “And throwing aside his garment, he rose and came to Jesus”, I would say this is a symbol of putting aside everything that made you comfortable at some place one time. He would have come with the garments to Jesus but here is my thinking, he knew he wasn’t going to be needing the garment for sitting around the road side begging. What a manner of faith to believe that as I go to Him, I am not coming back to where I’ve always been. Carrying the garment could have meant that I am coming to You but incase it doesn’t happen at least I still have my garment to cover me when I go back. I pray that we will cast a side any garments of fear, self pity and doubt and come to Him because He has called us.

Here comes the core of the message Mark 10:51, “So Jesus answered and said to him, “What do you want Me to do for you?” The blind man said to Him, Rabboni, that I may receive my sight”. What a powerful portion of scripture here. If you take a look at the story, you will see a progression on the five keys I had mentioned earlier. We are dealing with the last key which is as important as the other keys. One man staggered to the presence of Jesus blind, Jesus asks him a question. Can’t Jesus see that he is blind? I know that Jesus knows what this man desires and yet He still asking him ” what he would desire?” This is why I’m not into the prayer of God do whatever you want to do, do it Lord. Proverbs 16:1, “The preparation of the heart belong to man, But the answer of the tongue is from the Lord”, We prepare, God approves; We ask of Him, He approves of the answer. Mark 11:24, “Whatever things you ask (desire) when you pray….” The blind man could have said, “Lord whatever you see fit just do it or do whatever you want to do” but this was his response “Rabboni (Lord) that I may receive my sight”. This is what I call being specific, straight forward to the point. Be specific in your prayers, tell the Lord what you desire and let Him act on it according to His will. Being specific will help you tell whether God did it or not. If He did it praise the Lord, if He did not do it, He might have provided another way or something better, praise the Lord, if He did not do it at all, praise the Lord for the preparation of the heart belong to man but the answer of the tongue is from the Lord. He has the final say in your situation. So until God says no, keep asking.

In conclusion, let’s see what happened to this man Mark 10:52, “Then Jesus said to him, “Go your way; your faith has made you well”, And immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus on the road”. Jesus did not have faith for this man, this man had faith in Jesus and that is what made him well. His faith had pleased the Lord to finish what was already started by faith. Hebrews 11:6, “For without faith it is impossible to please Him, for he that comes to God must first believe that He is and that He is a rewarder of them that diligently seek Him”. Looking at this verse, the blind man put this into practice. Now watch this, his eyes are opened, all of a sudden he sees a man who had made him well, he sees the people who tried to stop him, he cannot not be taken advantage of any more, he has now the ability to make the right choices, right people to hang out with in this case he followed the Lord. For the first time he is not depending on any man for he was once blind, but now he can see.

I need my eyes to be opened for I feel handicapped in some areas of my life, I purpose to take the other parts of me functioning to help me overcome my dysfunctional part, I will develop faith to know that my eyes can be opened, I will make the move to call Him, I will be prepared for obstacles, I will encourage myself and allow people to encourage me too and I will be specific about what I desire of the Lord. Then once it’s been said and done, I will say, “once I was blind, but now I see”

Thanks

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mark 10:46-52, “…Rabboni, that I may receive my sight”.

May I say that whenever you’ve heard, your faith has been boosted and you have begin to call, obstacles will be right there trying to block. Watch this Mark 10:48, “Then many warned him to be quite; but he cried out all the more…” Small voices will tell you there is no way you can be helped so will some say too. He had been stepped on, ridiculed all his life because of his condition, he has a chance to get healed yet multitude wanted him to be quiet. Doesn’t anyone care for him to be healed? In other words, they are showing him that he does not deserve the Lord’s attention. And while we are at it, how many times has the devil whispered in your ear that you don’t deserve a chance to reach out to Him? that you’ve failed, you have issues and He will never be interested in what you have to say because He has better things to do?. You can easily get discouraged because of the obstacles on the way but just like Bartimaeus, you need to cry out even louder to drown the obstacles. You and I should not let an opportunity pass us just because we feel unworthy. It’s our unworthiness that causes us to call upon Him who is able. Hebrews 4:16, strengthens this “Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need”. This man needed mercy the reason he called boldly on Him who was able to give him mercy.

Mark 10:49, “So Jesus stood still and commanded him to be called”, Can a person be known in heaven and be feared in hell? True, as we see over and over we see in the scriptures with men and women who walked with God. The people who sought after Him were feared by their enemies for the enemy knew that God was with them and was fighting for them. One man stopped a journey out of Jericho by his cry. He knew that missing this opportunity could result into another season of waiting again. And who in their right mind would want to miss what they know for sure is of God? nobody even knew whether Jesus would pass by the same road Bartimaeus was on He is not looking to Jesus to perform a miracle so that he can have more money begging, all he desires is his eyes restored. With his cry, Jesus heard him, stopped and commanded him to be called, what an awesome time that as you are seeking God, all of a sudden He stops to attend to you. Remember that whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

Mark 10:49, “…Then they called the blind man, saying to him, “be of good cheer. Rise, He is calling you”. I think the people wanted quiet because he was stopping the Master from continuing with His program. Bartimaeus cry reached out to the Master’s ear and Jesus stopped doing everything He was doing to attend to him. I will boldly say this, it is possible to hang around Jesus and be in His presence and not feel a thing. It’s the people who are desperate for Him that get His attention. Desperate people do desperate things, they go an extra mile. Hasn’t the bible said in 1Thessalonians 5:17, that, “Pray without ceasing…”. which does not mean pray without stopping but it means pray without giving up. One man not even in the crowd got his attention so was the woman with the issue of blood . To make it interesting, the people who tried to silence him were the same people the Lord used to convey the message.

Cease from this mentality that He knows what you desire of him and so you just sit and wait and do nothing, the blind man did not. Maximize the moment, seize the opportunity, take advantage of the time, initiate and let Him take over. Don’t let your limitation stop you from activating the other part of you that can bring life to your limitations. You might not have what it takes but when you activate your strengths, it will help you gain favor with God to help you over come your limitations. To continue

Thanks

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mark 10:46-52, “…Rabboni, that I may receive my sight”.

The last comment on yesterday was , until you see who you are and where you are stationed, you will not seize the moment and take the advantage of the little time you have to make a decision. I will develop more on this as we look at today’s message. Keep these keys in mind for I will be touching on them, hearing, initiating, obstacles, encouragement, and being specific.

Mark 10:47, “And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out and say, “Jesus, son of David, have mercy upon me”. We’ve been blessed with the ability to hear. Remember this man was blind, he was handicapped in one area of his life but he also knew he had other senses that had the ability help bring back to life that part of him that was dead. This is where his ears and mouth played the big role. I know for me at times I can concentrate on what I don’t have and think that what I don’t have will actually just fall from heaven. I failed to remember that what I have can help me achieve what I don’t have, all I got do so is take what I have and put it into use. “And when he heard…”, he was blind but he could hear, he had never seen Jesus heal, but he heard what He could do (heal), he had healed before, so the blind man’s faith was not based on what he saw but on what he heard, this brings Romans 10:17, so clearly when it says “So then, faith comes by hearing and hearing by the word of God”. “He began to cry out”, he took upon himself to initiate the move by crying out to Jesus whom we had not seen and yet heard and believed in Him. Then he called according to Romans 10:13, “For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved”. I can see this man seizing the moment and taking advantage of the limited time that he has. There was a great multitude, what a chance to make more money by begging but he realized that what he desired or what he needed was more than what he had been receiving. Jesus passing by awakened the desire in his heart to be healed. His faith was built at the moment to believe that all things are possible to those who believe. Remember that he’s cry was not out of a want but for a need, Philippians 4:9, “But my God shall supply all your need, according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus”. If there was something in you that went dormant because you waited too long, got comfortable where are, when Jesus is passing by, His presence will awaken dreams and desires in you that went to a dormant stage because there was no way in the while world that you could see them working out without the Lord of the impossible showing up.

I would put aside the limitations I have and engage the other senses God has blessed me with, those will create avenues to heal the limitations in me. God will start with what we have. To continue.

title.rendered: Once Was Blind, But Now I see, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mark 10:46-52, “…Rabboni, that I may receive my sight”.

Whatever we share with you, make sure you test and prove them with the word of God to be sure that they are in line with God’s word. We have dedicated our time on this to speak the truth that first affects us before it reaches to anyone else. If God is going to use us, we want what comes from Him to change us inside out first, then use the same word to change someone else. Like I said before, this is more than inspiration, the messages are for life changing, transforming that we all grow, live under blessings and be a people who walk in victory. If you at times delete the messages without reading, you are missing a whole lot. There are times when I am discouraged, I go back to the one’s done before and they pump life in me again.

The message today is very simple and precise. If I could just talk about the conclusion before getting into it, the two things I would call the common denominator are seize the moment, take advantage of time!!!. I love to touch on different stories in the bible for they relate to us in some way. People relate more to stories told especially about something that happened and you can actually see how God came through for a person and was able to deliver, set them free, provide for them and many more.

In my text, Jesus came to Jericho with His disciples and on His way, a great multitude began to followed Him. The bible takes a few verses to pin point a man out of the crowd by the name of Bartimaeus, son of Timaeus. In this world people pin point mostly heroes, celebrities, athletes, sports figures and the like. When you hear of certain names, you just know who they are and what has caused them to be known. When you hear Michael Jackson, one thing that runs through your mind is that he is a celebrity, king of pop; and if you talk about Bruce Willis, you know him as a celebrity, a movie star. But who was Bartimaeus that the bible zeroed him out? was he a hero too? If you read verse 46 you will find that Bartimaeus was a blind beggar on the streets. What does the life of a blind beggar have to offer that is so fascinating and exciting for someone to want to know? There must be something extra ordinary that happened that caused this man to be noticed. He wasn’t even looking for attention but something happened.

The life of a blind person is not easy for instance, it’s easy to take advantage of them being by giving the wrong things just because they can’t see and determine. They can easily get hurt as they move around because it’s very easy to hit things, they become dependant and have to have someone do most of the things for them for example lead them, guide them, help them cross the road. They have a lot of limitations as to what they can and can’t do. They cannot be used as eye witnesses and many more. If I look at this in the spiritual sense, I see the same happening in the life of a believer or someone who has never received Christ in their lives.

Because of this man’s blindness, he stationed himself by the roadside begging. I believe that there were some folks who dropped him by the roadside in the morning and picked him up in the evening and out of what he made, he paid them for their service. In a condition like that, there is a possibility of ruling out any possibility of coming out of it and therefore you find yourself in the same situation over and over again. There is a chance that you can be settled and have a permanent residing place, trying to block out all the questions as to why I’m in this condition? and why me and not someone else? and no one even cares about where I am anymore. At first they did, but they got tired of dealing with the same me over and over again. I want us to put ourselves in this man’s situation and feel what he felt, look at your life and see where you have been blind and with that you went to wrong places, got involved with the wrong person, got into the wrong business, got into a cult, just got into things because you were blind to see what was right.

I got to stop for there is much I want to talk about that I don’t want to leave anything out. This what I leave you with this morning, until you see who you are and where you are stationed, you will not seize the moment and take the advantage of the little time you have to make a decision. To continue in the morning.

Thanks

title.rendered: You Are In It For A Reason

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Job 42:10, “And the Lord restored Job’s looses when he prayed for his friends. Indeed the Lord have Job twice as much as he had before”

As shared before, praying because “GOD CAN” has transformed my life in the area of prayer instead of praying “GOD WILL”. Le me share with you something else that has helped my prayer life in the past few years. You know of those times you find in yourself in bad habits, lack, sick, inflicted with pain and things that do not make life comfortable. What happens? if you know who your God is, you will come to Him immediately and ask His help to deal with it. You will agree with me that there have been times God did not do it even after you prayed for days, months and years. This used to really frustrate me and I came to God and I asked Him why He wasn’t responding to my cry over the issues, hang on I will share with you why.

Anytime God is going to do something, He will always prepare someone for the job. When He is raising you and I, He has someone else in mind. When God created the world, He allowed everything to have a cycle and thus not create something twice. Man was told to reproduce and fill the earth, this ought to be an indication that whenever God is going to do something, He will always use whatever is already there without creating something new.

To tie to what I’m sharing on, let’s look at 2Kings 4:1-6 which talks about a widow who had two sons. Her late husband feared the Lord but when he died, he left his wife with debts to which she was too poor to pay them. Because of her family’s condition, her two sons were to be taken to be slaves. Listen to what she does, she cries out to Elisha the prophet, 2Kings 4:2, “So Elisha said to her, “What shall I do for you? Tell me, what do you have in the house?” And she said, “Your maidservant has nothing in the house but a jar of oil”. What you think is nothing or small and cannot be used is what God will use. She only had a little jar of oil, in her eyes that was it but in the eyes of Elisha, God could do much more with that little jar of oil. 2Kings 4:3, “Then he said, “Go borrow vessels from everywhere, from all your neighbors-empty vessels; do not gather just few. vs. 4, “And when you have come in, you shall shut the door behind you and your sons; then pour into all those vessels, and set aside the full ones”. The instruction was for her to borrow empty vessels, more vessels, from the neighborhood, as many as she could get and from everywhere. I was hoping that the prophet would ask her to use the vessels she had. Now watch this, for you to really come out of your situation, at times God will allow you to be in a position where as you call on Him, He will remind you that someone else in the same condition is empty or has little just like you. God will prompt you to borrow those vessels meaning borrow people, friends, the sick, the prisoners, your neighbors, your colleagues and put a little oil of prayer in their lives. You know where to get help from, but as for them, they may not know what to do. We have established that God will not create something else when He has a means to get the job done “YOU”. As long as the woman put little oil in the vessels she had borrowed, the oil wasn’t running out, God was filling those vessels. At times you and I need to take that little prayer we have and instead of calling on God for what we want, we can start borrowing vessels and praying for them.

Job 42:10, “And the Lord restored Job’s looses when he prayed for his friends. Indeed the Lord have Job twice as much as he had before”. Job was brought to a level where some of his friends were at, as long as he had good health, good wife, children, wealthy, he could not know and understand what someone somewhere was going through, he was righteous and knew how to pray if he lacked. So God also allowed him to be in a tough situation so that God would use his situation to elevate someone else. 42 chapters gone, he has talked about the holiness of God, complained, talked about many things but nothing happens in his life until he prays for his friends in other words borrow his friends to put little oil in them. Now I understand why God would not deliver or answer some of the prayers I made to Him for I would easily forget that someone else is in that situation and may not know what to do. This has helped me forget about what I wanted from God and started lifting up someone’s needs and God was faithful to increase my oil. It’s through Job’s prayer for his friends that opened doors for restoration and God blessed him far beyond what he had from the beginning. You are in it for a reason, what are you going to do about it?

Thanks

Evans

title.rendered: What Defines How You Deal With Situations?

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Proverbs 23:7, “As he thinks in his heart so is he…”

Of all the things I have dealt with, nothing is more tailoring my life like the way I think of myself. You will agree with me that how you perceive yourself has a way of affecting your life. I would say that what we think of about ourselves matters a lot. If you continue to see yourself as defeated, sooner or later you will develop the symptoms because as the bible says, “As he (man) thinks in his heart so is he”. What comes out your mouth is a reflection of what you have inside. If you are constantly speaking defeat, already we can tell that you are harboring defeat inside, Proverbs 18:22, “death and life is the power of the tongue”. What comes out of your mouth can be building or tearing, can be sweet waters or poisoning water. What you think of yourself will cause you to speak what you have inside. The Shunamite woman saw a situation where her child was dead but inside of her she had faith to believe God. Because of what she believed, she pushed it out to her mouth and began to make a confession, “ALL IS WELL WITH MY SOUL”. If that is not enough, the woman with the issue of blood also knew her condition but still as she thought of herself propelled her to push out the faith in her by saying, “IF I MAY BUT TOUCH THE HEM OF HIS GARMENT, I KNOW WILL BE MADE WHOLE”. Two common things with these women were that they both had evident problems but they did not allow them to define how they felt about themselves in the situation. They understood the concept of as “you think in your heart so are you” and therefore they refused to give in to defeat. I’m not saying try and ignore the reality, what I’m saying is see the reality as a means by which God will do something and make a confession. Job took advantage of the situation though it was unbearable.

A part from what we think of ourselves, we have to be very careful about what we speak into others especially the kids. For those who are parents, the bible says in Proverbs 22:6, “Train up a child in the way he should go; and when he is old, he will not depart from it”. You call your child dumb, stupid, worthless, he will grow seeing himself that way. Parents ought to invest in their children that regardless of what other people see in them, you have a better way of looking at things in their lives. You have the passion, the zeal to bring them up in the way God desires of you. Kids learn from what they hear mostly from their parents and what they see in them. If the father abuses the mother, the child exposed to that most likely to do the same to his wife. If he comes from abusive home physically and verbally, he will likely do the same. Parents have to set an example to the kids by their life style and what comes out of their mouths. I fail to understand why many parents are very frustrated with their kids when they sowed wrong seeds in them, Galatians 6:7, “Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man sows, that shall he also reap”. You are the role model for your kids. Parents instead of worrying about what your kids will turn out to be when you turn them loose, go into prayer closet, intercede for them. Lay your hands on them and cover them by the blood, speak life into them and let them know that you are there for them, encourage them, build self confidence, trust in them and the things people might say about them will not change how they feel about themselves through the affirmation provided by mom and dad. Provide discipline a sign of love, lead them to church, a place of growth and be the one who they look up to. Most of children feels that their dads are the most valuable people, strong and one they would want to be like when they grow up, don’t take that away from them by the wrong things you do and speak over them. How do you think of yourself, what are the confessions to show what is inside? how does what you do or say affect the younger generation? Blessings Evans

Thanks

Evans

title.rendered: A Letter of Thanks, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning, Today is Pastor Phil and Stephanie’s 3rd wedding anniversary. If you are touched to bless them, send them a note. Ev

1Th 2:13 And we also thank God continually because, when you received the word of God, which you heard from us, you accepted it not as the word of men, but as it actually is, the word of God, which is at work in you who believe.

Dear Devotion team,

First let me take the time to thank the Lord for all of you. Evans and I are grateful to the Lord because of you. Over the years there have been many of you that have written back to us words of encouragement concerning the devotions that we have written. We try our best to bring you the Word of God and not the word of man. The Apostle Paul wrote, “And we also thank God continually because, when you received the word of God, which you heard from us, you accepted it not as the word of men, but as it actually is, the word of God, which is at work in you who believe.” There are so many that want to hear the word of man. Paul said to Timothy, “For the time will come when men will not put up with sound doctrine. Instead, to suit their own desires, they will gather around them a great number of teachers to say what their itching ears want to hear. 4 They will turn their ears away from the truth and turn aside to myths.” This is such a deadly thing for God’s people, because the word of man does not bring about the glory of God. We try to glorify our Father in every message that is sent.

Evans and I thank the Lord that we have been able to share the Word of God which encouraged, equipped, challenged, and even rebuked all to help train God’s people in righteousness through applying the truth of His Word. We thank each of you for taking the time to read the messages that we feel the Lord is sharing through us.

1. For creating us in His image – Psalm 100:3: “Know ye that the LORD he is God: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.” We have not evolved from some ancient muddy glob, but rather have been created by the hand of the Mighty God.

2. For redeeming us by His blood – Revelation 5:9: “And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation.”

3. For sending His Son and His Spirit – II Corinthians 9:15: “Thanks be unto God for his unspeakable gift.”

4. For other Christians – That’s right. We are instructed not only to pray for other believers, but to actually thank God for them. Time and again, the apostle Paul did this. Philippians 1:3 is a great example: “I thank my God upon every remembrance of you ….”

5. For His Word – Psalm 119:105 “Psalm 119:105 Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light for my path… (Heb 4:12) For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

May you look to His Word today as we thank you for receiving his word with gladness. Please meditate on Psalm 105 and Hebrews 4:12 throughout your day. Hey why not share the reason you are thankful with a non-believer today. Happy Turkey Day to everyone. Trivia Question: What chemical in Turkey makes you sleepy?

Until the nets are filled…Pastor Phil

Good morning,

Luke 17:11-19, “And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, returned, and with a loud voice glorified God, and fell down on his face at His feet, giving Him thanks”

As we are getting ready for thanksgiving, let me share this devo with you. Thanksgiving to me is a time of reflection on what the Lord has done in the past year and giving Him thanks.  Been disappointed many times during thanksgiving dinners seeing people give thanks but not direct it to the One. My question is, did things just happen that no one could trace their origin of those blessings that calls for thanks?

In the book of Luke the 17th chapter, 11th division starts by saying, “Now it happened as He went to Jerusalem that He passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee”. “It happened”, though to some it may sound like it was a coincident that He passed through these cities but we know what God does He already planned it. The bible continues to tell us in verse 12, “Then as He entered a certain village, there met Him ten men who were lepers, who stood a far off”. Jesus appears in this village, I’m not sure whether anyone knew of His passing by but we are told that there met Him ten lepers. If you look at people who had leprosy in the bible, they were considered cursed people, unclean, outcast, they were not to live in the city with everyone, they lived in the caves. They walked around chanting “unclean, unclean”. How they happened to be in the city at the time Jesus was passing by is no coincident. vs. 13. “And they lifted up their voices and said, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us”. Again we see ten men who understands that nothing just happens. If there is going to be any change in their lives, someone has to speak something that will cleanse them. This was the type of a disease that was not easy to get rid of but I can imagine them having the faith to believe in Jesus. They all lifted their voices because they all believed in what He could do.

vs. 14, “So when He saw them, He said to them, “Go show yourselves to the priests”. Pause here for a sec, how many times have you prayed for something to come in a way you expected it only to be told to do something different? Imagine coming to Jesus, crying for healing. Instead of Him telling you that you are healed or even touching you, all He tells you is go and show yourself, in other words go and testify. He is telling them to go and testify but doesn’t tell them that as they go, they would be healed. I would not know how these men reacted but they have faith to believe without questioning and they leave. vs. 14, “…And so it was that as they went, they were cleansed”, nothing just happens!!!. Jesus did not speak healing, did not touch them but sent them away and in the process, they got healed. Your surviving this year did not just happen, trace the root of it and you will see that God was behind it, your promotion did not just happen so was your good health, your joy, peace, confidence, strength, provisions, protection, guidance, your raise, you name it. James 1:17, “Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above and comes down from the Father of lights, with whom there is not variation or shadow of turning”. Nothing just happens, both good and evil can be traced from their authors.

Vs 15, “And one of them, when he saw he that he was healed returned…” Can we say that it was just one of them who realized that this did not just happen ’cause Jesus had something to do with it. He is healed, he has been restored, no more is he an outcast, now he can have relationships again, he can be close to his family. Too good to show the priests first but come back and give glory to God, falling on Jesus feet and giving Him thanks. He could have given thanks to the mother nature since Jesus did not touch him or speak healing in him, he could have thought of being lucky but this man understood that what happened was no coincident, Jesus Christ of Nazareth was the reason for His healing and because of that he came back. Jesus asked about the other 9 who were also healed. He did not question whether they were healed, He knew they were healed because when He said go, it was done. His question was, vs. 17, “Were there not ten cleansed? but where are the nine? vs. 18, “Were there not there any found who returned to give glory to God except this foreigner?. We can be spoiled brats just snatching what has been offered to us and going away without giving thanks. When kids are growing, the parents tend to teach them to give thanks when something is given to them or anybody else they approve of, how come when we get older we think that things just happen therefore we see no need to give thanks? And this is not only left for thanksgiving day but always being thankful. David speaks in Psalm 92:1, “It is good to give thanks to the Lord”, Psalm 26:7, “offer to God thanksgiving”, Psalm 95:2, “Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving”, Psalm 100:4, “Enter into His gates with thanksgiving, And into His courts with praise. Be thankful to Him, and bless His name”

As you celebrate thanksgiving, know who is the author of every good thing in your life and direct all the praise and thanksgiving back to Him. Let this be a reminder to us all that nothing just happens therefore we constantly need to give Him thanks whether it be for
something small or big. One man out of the ten returned, please return and give thanks to Him. Have a blessed, glorious, joyous thanksgiving.
Ev

Thanks

title.rendered: The Road Less Traveled, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,8 “And a highway will be there; it will be called the Way of Holiness. The unclean will not journey on it; it will be for those who walk in that Way; wicked fools will not go about on it. 9 No lion will be there, nor will any ferocious beast get up on it; they will not be found there. But only the redeemed will walk there, 10 and the ransomed of the LORD will return. They will enter Zion with singing; everlasting joy will crown their heads. Gladness and joy will overtake them, and sorrow and sighing will flee away.” (Isaiah 35:8-10)

Robert Frost wrote, “Two roads diverged in a wood, I took the one less traveled by, and I- And that has made all the difference.” If we choose the right road it will make all the difference in life for us as well. Life has often been described as the way one lives on a way, a path, a road, or other such words that depict travel, journeying or direction. Isaiah says “…a highway will be there,” which is to say that there is a certain highway that is ever present. However although the highway can be seen clearly, not all see it. Even all those who do see it do not travel on it. Why not? It is because it is “called the way of holiness”, as all highways have a name.”

What kind of terrain does this highway have? Is it smooth, void of bumps, potholes, and sharp turns? No, it has its fair share of all of these and more. God Himself is the architect of this road. It is not an easy road to take, because this is not a highway that one can travel on in their own strength. This is a road that one must “…be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus (2 Tim 2:1).” Since this is a road of holiness, only the redeemed of the Lord may journey on it. To redeem (exagorazo) means “to buy out of slavery” by paying a price. Christ paid this our sin debt by dying on the cross. The redeemed is an elect family, the body of Christ, which helps one another to walk on. It is hard to know what to do at times on this road because one must “walk by faith and not by sight.” The road is not a wide road, but a rather narrow one because few find it (Matt 7:14), and there is none other like it. Although many walk on this road, The Apostle Paul described his travels on this road as a race in which he ran for the prize promised. He said, “I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith. Now there is in store for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will award to me on that day–and not only to me, but also to all who have longed for his appearing (2 Tim 4:7-8).”

Oh yes Christian if you are on this Highway of Holiness it is because you have the power of Christ in you, because, it is “Not by might nor by power, but by my Spirit,’ says the LORD Almighty.” Oh He knows your every trial and uses them to strengthen and refine your faith in Him, because He has called you to walk by faith and not by sight. There is a crown of righteousness awaiting your victorious arrival and “to all who have longed for His appearing,” because “He is a rewarder of those that diligently seek Him” (Heb 11:6). So don’t give up and never give in. Get up after every bump you hit, climb out of each pothole that temporally may take you down, “for though a righteous man falls seven times, he rises again” (Pro 24:16), and live diligently with a reckless abandonment to “…press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me (you) heavenward in Christ Jesus” (Phil 3:14). Keep your eyes on the finish line though you can not see it with the natural eye, your eyes of faith has the vision to see “Him who is invisible” (Heb 11:27). And for those that are in ministry or desire to be, then keep your run in the race steady and don’t give up when your legs of faith grow weary. Keep running a good race, and “Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up” Galatians 6:9).

Application: Be encouraged; stay on the Highway of Holiness, even if it is The Road Less Traveled it is the road Jesus instructed on us to take (Matt 7:14). You don’t want to travel on the alternative road, the Broad Way (Matt 7:13)!!

Good morning,

Daniel 10:12, “Then he said to me, “Do not fear, Daniel, for from the first day that you set your heart to understand, and to humble yourself before your God, your words were heard; and I have come because of your words.

We live in a time when everything is needed in a hurry. We talk about fast food restaurants where you drop in and get what you want, how you want it and fast, any signs of delay reveals frustrations. We cannot work with God in the same manner for His times are not our times. God sees far beyond what we see with our natural eyes and knows what is best. You have to keep on knocking, seeking, asking. It’s either God’s way or no way as simple as that.

God’s seasons are not at your beck. If the first stroke of the flint does not bring forth the fire, you must strike again. God will hear prayer, but He may not answer it at the time which we in our minds have appointed; He will reveal Himself to our seeking hearts, but not just when and where we have settled in our own expectations. Hence the need of perseverance and importunity in supplication.

Daniel set himself to pray and fast for three weeks when he saw a vision that needed interpretation. This is a man who knew what he needed to do and what it would cost him to get the result. Pray without ceasing add fasting to strength your prayers and watch what happens. Daniel’s prayer reached the first day and it was answered but there was the prince of air blocking the messenger from bringing the answer to him. There was a delay but Daniel kept on seeking, knocking, asking while the heaven was in motion breaking through the barriers. When the bible says in 1Thessalonians 5:17, “Pray without ceasing” does not indicate, “pray without stopping” it indicates, “pray without giving up”.

In the days of flint and steel and brimstone matches we had to strike and strike again, dozens of times, before we could get a spark to live in the tinder; and we were thankful enough if we succeeded at last. At times we stopped but did not give up. Shall we not be as persevering and hopeful as to heavenly things? We have more certainty of success in this business than we had with our flint and steel, for we have God’s promises at our back. Never let us despair. God’s time for mercy will come; yea, it has come, if our time for believing has arrived. Ask in faith nothing wavering; but never cease from petitioning because the King delays to reply. Strike the steel again. Make the sparks fly and have your tinder ready; you will get a light before long. –C. H. Spurgeon. Daniel the man of God did, we too need to. Blessings Evans

Thanks
